1.content:
Upon touching the strange artifact, Carl was blown backwards by some kind of mysterious force, a distance of fully 30 feet. He landed with a sickening thump just in front of one of the warehouse walls. For a moment, he didn't move, but then he began to get to his feet, somewhat groggily. "Fuck!" he groaned, as he checked himself to see if he was hurt, miraculously...he wasn't.

"What the hell was that?" came the next obvious answer Carl asked himself. He hadn't noticed that he was now completely sober, all effects of the alcohol he had drinking all night had gone.

Walking back over to the meteor, Carl saw that it was no longer glowing, however he still refrained from touching it again. He circled it a few times, wondering whether to report the occurence, but he decided against it. Hating the police as much as he did, he wanted nothing to do with them. Glancing at his watch, Carl noticed it had stopped. "Great!" he sighed, letting his arm slump back down by his side.

"Fuck this, I'm going home" he then told himself, deciding to leave the area...and to leave the mysterious, other wordly object where it was.

Carl headed down the street towards the direction of his apartment, taking little notice of the people around him. It was 10:47pm and after what had just happened, he just wanted to get home and hit the sack.

11.content:
Carl trudged home in the constant state of quiet rage and internal unrest that had characterized much of his life up to this point. He walked slowly through the night as the breeze drifted through the trees and the quiet streets of the neighborhood. Few in the part of town were out this late at night; this was the type of place where unpleasant things happened at this hour.

Arriving at his apartment building, Carl ascended the stairs, each step a chore Carl seemed to undertake with a resounding absence of grace and poise. As Carl walked noisily up the beaten-up wooden stairs that creaked below his weight, he reached into his pocket and fiddled about with his keys, one of which was to his own apartment. He pulled them out and looked through them hastily. "Which fucking one is it?” he asked himself, "let’s see...this one’s to the mailbox,” he said as he ruled out one key. "This one's to the safety deposit box...here's to he damn storage unit,” he went on, "ah ha! Here we go,” Carl said as he shoved the key into the lock and opened the door to his home.

He entered the mess of an apartment, tossing the keys roughly on the table right next to the tower of beer cans and the nearly filled ash tray. The harsh aroma of cigarette smoke hung thickly in the air. Carl's flicking on a light switch illuminated the place a bit, though the light was on its last legs and so flickered a bit. He lumbered slowly over to his favorite chair, brushed it free of potato chip remnants, and plopped himself down in it in front of the television. He grabbed the remote and turned on the TV. Carl sat in relative silence as he flipped through the channels, his only noises being the curses he hurled at the refs in the Ohio State basketball game that didn’t turn out as he wanted. Slowly though, Carl's long day got the better of him, and he dozed off.

Carl awoke suddenly as he heard three loud knocks at the door. Dazed, he looked about the apartment go get his senses about him, the time required for which brought three more loud knocks. Carl stiffly stood up out of the comfy chair. "I'm comin’ dammit...hold your fucking horses,” he said as he headed to the door. After undoing a couple locks, Carl pulled the door back gruffly and beheld the person who dared disturb his slumber.

The sight before Carl’s eyes made him wonder whether he should be excited or scared. On one hand, it was a cop; on the other hand, she was HOT! "Carl Edwards?” the woman asked in mechanical voice, seeming devoid of personality. "U...yeah,” he said as he stepped back to behold the woman before him. My, she was a sight! This woman had curly blonde hair that hung down past her shoulders. It framed a face that suggested this woman was in her mid-40s; a wrinkle appeared here and there owing to age, but she still looked spectacular. Farther down on this woman’s wonderful body was a set of very large boobs that strained against the tight material of the police uniform. Luckily for Carl, the officer had left the top few buttons of her uniform undone because of the heat of the morning, thus allowing him to see the tops of the wonderfully full, jello-like mounds that adorned her chest.

The officer had a full body...farther down there was a belly that seemed to be a little bit bloated, with a bit of flab sticking out. For a woman of her age, it was to be expected, as were the wonderfully wide, motherly hips and accompanying mom-butt, that beautifully full posterior few younger women had. All this was encased in a tight-fitting police uniform that accentuated every curve, every jiggle, and every beautiful bounce.

"Mr. Edwards?" came the woman's voice as Carl stood numbly and looked her over lustily. "Uh....yeah...sorry. What?” he stammered. "May I enter?” she said. "What an unusual way to ask to come in," Carl thought as he stood aside and motioned the busty officer inside. "Sorry about the mess,” he told her, "I didn’t expect I'd be getting a visit from the city's finest," he said, somewhat irritated at the sight of a cop, even one as beautiful as this one. The officer entered, though her movements were somewhat strange, awkward really. The cop's boobs jiggled with each clumsy step. Now in the apartment, she closed the door. Strangely, she also locked it.

"Mr. Edwards," she began, "my name is Brenda Nelson. There was a...disturbance...in town last night. Do you know anything about it?" she said, crossing her arms across her beautiful and full chest. "Nope," Carl said, not wanting to be hauled in to answer more questions about what he saw, "I ain’t seen nothin’." "Are you certain of that, Mr. Edwards?" Nelson said in her still-emotionless voice, tilting her head to the side in a quizzical but almost robotic fashion. She began to move toward Carl, and he began to back up. “Uh…yeah sure. I was home watchin’ the game and havin’ some smokes,” he said, wondering at Nelson’s rather aggressive moves in his direction, and having some trouble keeping his eyes from her jiggling chest.

Suddenly, Nelson reached out and grabbed Carl by the throat, squeezing his neck hard and lifting him clean off the ground, leaving his feet kicking in mid-air as he struggled. "What the fuck?!" he managed to squeal as he tried with all his might to pry her tightened fingers from his throat, but to no avail. He looked down at Nelson to see her face was teeming with rage. Then, Carl saw something even more strange. Nelson's eyes seemed to glow green for a moment, and she opened her mouth, letting out a slight hissing sound as a strange lizard-like tongue snaked its way out and tasted the air. "What the hell are you?!" Carl struggled to get out. She spoke, "I am the thing sent to retrieve the technology you stole; I will pry those powers from your lifeless corpse, human!" but the voice that came out was not hers alone. It seemed a strange amalgam of Brenda Nelson’s voice and that of another entity...something...alien.

"Powers?” Carl grunted, "what powers?” "Do not deceive me you little worm!” she said angrily, her voice still strange, "I have spent enough time here forcing my way into this pathetic human body and enduring the advances of the males of your pitiful species. The mammary glands on this body's front seem to be very important in your culture, but I care nothing for them. Now, tell me what I want to know!" she demanded. Thinking quickly, Carl reached into his pocket and brought out the lighter from the night before. He lit it and held the fire close to the hand that clutched his throat. Nelson held fast for a moment, but then the intense heat became too much for her.

"Aaaarggghhhh," the creature said, as she let Carl go, letting him drop roughly to the ground. The creature recoiled, holding her hand in pain, her eyes glowing green again. Carl hit the ground rather ungracefully, staggering back. Because he was already near the edge of the room, as he staggered back, Carl put himself through his own window. Hearing the crashing of glass behind him, Carl then felt himself falling. "Oh shit!" he screamed as he crashed through the glass and into the open air, beginning to fall. Carl fell through the air, flailing about as his vision was filled alternately by buildings, the ground, and the sky. Suddenly, Carl slammed into something below. "Awww fuck," he groaned as he felt pain in his back. He looked around and saw broken glass about him. He rolled over and got his feet back on the ground, realizing that he had landed on the officer's police car.

1) Carl finds somewhere to hide.

111.content:
Carl brushes the broken glass from his chest and rolls clumsily off the police car. He’s got some pain in his back and legs, but he seems to be healing quickly. "Crazy bitch!” Carl exclaims to himself as he runs over to the side of the building, expecting Officer Nelson to come bounding from the building in the next couple minutes. He hesitantly opens the lid on a dumpster next to the building and dives in to save himself. In among the stench of rotting food, Carl peers out from the partially opened lid of the container, wanting to wait until Nelson...or the thing inside her...has left.

He looks up to the window, and he sees Nelson still up there, simply looking down into the alley. "What the hell is she doing?” Carl muses to himself in genuine confusion. Then, officer stands up in the frame where the window used to be. Bracing herself, she leaps from the building! She flies through the air and hits the ground rather gracefully, causing a wonderful jiggle in her full and voluptuous body. "Holy shit!" Carl exclaimed as Nelson just stood up and brushed herself off very quickly, seeming to be in no pain. She looked around a little, the lizard-like tongue protruding from her mouth again. Finding no one and with her car now demolished, the officer set out on foot. She walked, hips swaying beautifully, down the vacant alley toward the open street.

"That was too damn close!” Carl said to himself as he climbed from the dumpster and wiped himself off. Fairly certain he could not return to his apartment, Carl needed to find somewhere to decompress. He walked through the alley, surprised a bit at how quickly the pain had seemed to go away. He walked through the throngs of people, always afraid that Officer Nelson would be the next one he saw, and who would see him. The sun shone down brightly on the crowd as Carl made his way through it. He crossed the street to another apartment building and entered, walking up another set of creaky stairs and down a narrow hallway.

He walked up to apartment 4C, one inhabited by a friend of his, and knocked. After a few moments, someone fiddled with the locks on the other side, and the door opened. Standing before Carl was his long-time friend and partner in crime Phillip Kellerman, or Phil for short. He was a short man, only about five feet six inches tall, with a rather plump build (thanks to too much beer and pizza), thinning black hair, and an unshaven face. The door opened, and Phil smiled, "Carl dude, how’s it go...” and he abruptly stopped, the smile quickly dropping off his face. He put his finger to his nose to pinch his nostrils shut. "Dude, don’t take this wrong, but you fucking stink!” he declared, backing away.

"I know, Phil, that's actually kind of what I'm here about. I had to hide in a damn dumpster from a psycho-bitch cop! This chic is seriously messed up...can I crash here?" Carl said pleadingly. Phil paused. "Sure,” he said, "but you're taking a damn shower!” Phil stepped back as Carl entered the apartment and made a b-line for the bathroom. He quickly disrobed and looked himself over, amazed at the absence of cuts and bruises, or even really pain of any kind, from his fall. Carl quickly showered and emerged smelling much better. He put on a set of clothes belonging to Phil's brother Jim, a man of about his own size.

1112.content:
As Carl exited the bathroom now fully clothed, he searched for his friend. "Phil?” he called out. No answer. “Phil!” he tried again. Still no answer. Carl drifted over to the counter, strewn upon which were beer bottles and Twinkie rappers, as well as a note. Carl bent over to read it. "Carl, ran across town to see my ma...something about needing a new ceiling fan put in. Back whenever. Phil.” "He'll probably be a while,” Carl thought. He paced about wondering what to do, realizing soon that he sorely needed a rest. His slumber had been unduly interrupted by Officer Nelson, or whatever thing that was inside her body. Now was perhaps a time to get some shut-eye.

Carl plopped himself down on the couch, folded his arms over his chest, and closed his eyes. As he drifted toward sleep, Carl felt strange. He felt...lighter, almost as if he were drifting out of his body. Thinking this feeling was odd, Carl opened his eyes and looked about, realizing that he now was above the back of the couch for some reason. He turned his head to glance down only to see his own body lying there! "Holy shit!,” Carl said in disbelief, and he suddenly fell to the floor, rolling sideways a bit right off the couch. He slowly picked himself up off the floor and glanced at what he thought was the impossible: his own lifeless body there before him. He snapped his finger a few times over his own head, as if to wake himself, but to no avail.

"Am...am...am I dead?” Carl asked himself as he staggered back in amazement. Carl put his hands to his head, trying to make sense of the rush, of all the things that had befallen him today. "What the hell's going on!?” he demanded, as he began to run toward the exit of the apartment, just needing air. It was only after Carl was in the hallway of the apartment complex that he realized he'd completely phased through the damn door! "Oh...oh my god,” he said, starting to breathe quite heavily.

Suddenly, Carl heard footsteps nearby. He looked in the direction of the noise and saw its source. Down the hall and close to the stairs was a woman. Her name: Leah Hernandez. She was about 40 or 42 years of age, having come from Mexico as a fairly young child. She had long black hair that ran down to the middle of her back. She'd had three children; this, combined with the fact that she now approached middle-aged, meant that her body had begun to give way a little bit. Carl looked at her face and saw the beginnings of a wrinkle here and there. Her body was...full. Leah had a voluptuous and curvy form; she was not fat by any means, but she certainly had some meat on her bones. Her breasts were large and jiggled beautifully, much to Carl's pleasure. Her belly had a bit of flab, but not too much, and her hips were wonderfully wide. Attached to said hips was an absolutely beautiful ass, one that swayed back and forth with her every beautiful step. Her legs were smooth, but thick and meaty at the same time.

Carl's main concern was talking to her...he needed help. He ran up to her and beheld her spectacular body. She was wearing yoga clothes, clothes that hugged every glorious curve of her body. "Mam, can you please help me...I...I think I'm going crazy or something,” he asked, panicked. The woman said nothing; she just opened her door and walked into her apartment. Desperate, Carl followed her in. "Lady, please...please I just need to talk to somebody here!” he implored, but the result was the same.

She walked over to her table and bet over to write something down, thus exposing her wonderfully full ass encased tightly in the work-out clothes. Looking at the table, Carl could see she was writing a grocery list. "Answer me!” Carl shouted as he went to take her hand. As he did, the strangest thing happened. Carl didn't grab her hand...his hand phased into hers! Leah seemed to be trying to write, but her hand just did not cooperate. "Holy crap...” Carl said, amazed at what he was seeing. He thought this might be a way to communicate. Leah was obviously distressed, unable to control the actions of her own appendages. As she grunted and gritted her teeth, her hand scribbled something on the paper.

When Carl was done, he removed his hand from hers, and they both stepped back in exasperation. Leah approached the notepad pensively and gazed at it. Scrawled upon the paper in Carl's handwriting was the word “HELP!!!” "Oh dios mio,” Leah said, and her jaw dropped. She stepped back in horror, and her pulse quickened. Carl was desperate. Then a thought struck him. "...may have to go for broke here,” Carl said. He slowly stepped up behind Leah Hernandez so that his posture matched up with hers. She stood there breathing heavily because of the thing that had just freaked her out. Slowly, Carl inched closer and simply stepped into her body.

The process was a bit rough. Leah's voluptuous body shook and convulsed a bit as she struggled for control. Within mere seconds, though, Carl took over. His vision cleared, and he brought up his hand to brush beautiful locks of black hair from his field of view. In so doing, he looked as his dainty, womanly hands, a few shades darker than he was used to.

"Oh my go...” he began, only to be cut short by the strangeness of his higher voice and accent. He put his hand to his mouth in amazement, which led him to poke and prod at his smooth skin. Gone was the stubble of a beard, replaced with the beautiful, full, blemish-free face of a middle-aged Latina woman. His hands probed farther down. There was an odd but undeniable weight on his chest. Glancing down, Carl noted two very large globes protruding from his chest. He smiled in delight. Carl grasped he low-hanging collar of his work-out shirt and pulled it forward enough to reveal the two gorgeous mounds. He jumped up and down in delight, eliciting a beautiful jiggle from them.

His hands continued their journey down to his slightly flabby middle and his wonderfully round ass and wide hips. He slapped his new body on the ass, feeling a wonderful shaking as he did. "This woman is...perfect,” he said as he looked himself over and glanced into the mirror at Leah Hernandez's reflection, smiling deviously.

113.content:
With the tinkling of glass above as a few more shards fell from the broken window, Carl looked up, still nursing his back. He saw the police officer...or whatever was inside her, leap from the window and land on her feet not far from him. Despite the drop, she seemed completely unharmed, and even the other people in the street couldn't believe what they were seeing. Carl just set off running as he saw officer Nelson's eyes again glow green...a look of anger etched on her face. She wasted no time in pursuing Carl as he ran.

Narrowly avoiding being hit by several cars, Carl stumbled...did a front roll...and then clambered back to his feet before darting into an alleyway. The creature inside Brenda Nelson's body kept its pace as it ran after Carl, the huge breasts of its host bounced heavily with each stride, and it didn't think twice before knocking into other humans who got in its way...sending them flying several feet through the air. "You can't escape from me human!" "Brenda" shouted after Carl in her strange sounding voice.

"Oh I'm gonna fucking try believe me!" Carl thought as he tried to draw breath and kept running. The 'officer' behind him didn't seem to tire, at least not at first, no ordinary woman of Brenda's age and build would have been able to pursue him for nearly this long and he knew it.

Bolting into another busy road, Carl went tumbling over the front of a car and then picked himself up, taking a brief second to draw a much needed breath before resuming his attempted escape from his pursuer. When the creature emerged into the street it leapt up onto the front of the car and dented the hood...before leaping a full 20 feet through the air and into another alleyway after Carl. By now, both Carl and Brenda's bodies were perspiring heavily, but Carl was the worse for wear. The years of smoking hadn't done anything for his lungs and he decided to head into a cheap looking hotel after rounding another corner. He slammed the front door behind him and ran straight past the receptionist and up several flights of stairs.

Upon reaching the top (7th floor), Carl started trying all the door handles, and eventually found one that opened. He didn't hesitate before barging into the room, closing the door behind him and sliding down the door. He didn't know if "Brenda" had followed him inside, he had no way of knowing unless she came banging on the door. He just winced in pain as he held his back, and he tried to keep his heavy breathing as quiet as possible.

Just then...

115.content:
The impact with the police cruiser is unfamiliar even for him. Though he has had a few close calls in his day, none of them ever compared to surviving a fall that would have been fatal if not for ... his new-found powers. That psycho-bombshell of a cop spoke about powers, but didn't give any details, only that they were stolen. Despite him surviving his drop, Carl eventually passes out due to how new the feeling is to his human body.

Several hours later, how many, in fact, Carl wouldn't know, he wakes up in what looks like a hospital room. Around him is a curtain, that in a way, makes the space his bed and the medical equipment, like the heart rate monitor and the bed pan, occupy, much like a makeshift room. The space above the curtain allows the ambient noises of a ward in a hospital enter his space. All of a sudden, the curtain parts and in comes a male nurse dressed in the iconic scrubs followed by two male police officers. They stare straight into his open eyes, but to his surprise, Carl notices that the officers are ignorant to his wakefulness. This is probably the first time he has been this close to a policeman and not have to assume the position, not that there would be any need for a full-body search in the hospital garb the staff has dressed him in. One of the officers, the one who was Caucasian and had somewhat of a beer belly, spoke up, asking the nurse, "How long has he been in this state?"

"Mr. Edwards has been like this for close to two days, with no significant changes, officer," the nurse answered. "We've been running tests, but the results say he's perfectly healthy."

"So he's not going to wake up anytime soon?" the other officer, who was black, asked. "This just means I'm getting off from my shift early, right Albert?"

"Right you are," the other officer replied. "Thanks for your time." With that done, the two officers exited past the curtain, leaving the nurse alone with Carl.

Assuming the officers were ignorant of the fact that he had his eyes wide open the entire time, Carl didn't the nurse was oblivious to him being awake. But the nurse started to act strangely. Before, when the nurse spoke to the two police officers, he spoke with a masculine voice, but once they were gone, the nurse now spoke with a feminine voice, but with the huskiness of a man Carl knew all too well. Being a criminal, he's had his share and taste of most of the illegal activities of the city, especially in the taverns and the stripclubs in the red light district, This nurse reminded him of one night he'd like to forget, but can't find the mental strength to do so. She, Carl thought, was actually a he ... and a prostitute working streets no less. This nurse had a similar, if not the same crazy personality.

"Damn, you are so fine underneath this gown, Mr. Edwards. No wonder those two officers couldn't keep their eyes off of you," the nurse said, in a combination of casual voice and whisper, so as not to expose himself. Suddenly, a hand gracefully placed itself on Carl's inner thigh, and Carl could feel the whole thing. The freshly manicured hand snaked its way ever so slightly up to a very private place. One second, Carl had no control over his physical body, but then the next he mustered enough strength to break away and get to his feet, but the sight before him was even more disturbing.

He stood beside his bed watching the upsetting scene unfold. There he lay, motionless, disadvantaged against the perverted advances of this gay nurse. "What the fuck is happening?!" Carl exclaimed.

"That is rather disheartening, I'd say," a somewhat feminine, ghostly voice speaks. Startled, Carl looked left and right, and then eventually behind him, finding no one.

"Is this a dream?" Carl continued with the questions, asking them due to the shock of the situation.

"Hardly," the voice spoke once more. Carl looked around again, to no avail. Where was this disembodied voice coming from? He looked at the nurse, to see if he was the one responding to his questions. Nope, Carl said to himself. The nurse continued to speak his own perverted speech all the while inappropriately touching the body that lay on the bed in front of him.

"Who's talking?" Carl asked, this time directly at the voice.

"I am," the voice answered.

"Who are you?" Carl continued.

"I am like you, a fugitive, a criminal. That said, I guess you can say that I AM YOU," the voice mockingly said. Whoever owned the voice sensed the concern on Carl's face and apologized. "Sorry, I was just fooling with you, human. This ... is ME."

From behind the curtain, a female nurse, dressed in patterned scrubs, appeared. Once seeing the gay nurse groping the helpless patient, she scolds him, "What do you think you are doing Mikey?" Mikey quickly removes his hands from the body, stashing them behind his back. Startled, he tries to defend himself, but only manages to stutter and choke on his words. "You're lucky you have me as your supervisor today. If the doctor was here, you would be fired. Would you like that, Mikey?" The gay nurse shakes his head. "Get outta here. Beverly needs changing in 412. I suggest you get to it then." With that the male nurse briskly removes himself from the scene. Carl, who witnessed the whole thing unfold before his eyes, only looked on with wonder. I thought the voice was going to show itself, he thought. Just then, the nurse rounded the bed and approached Carl, her eyes looking straight into his. In disbelief, Carl tried to look elsewhere, but upon seeing no hand at his brow, which he habitually did to hide his face in large crowds, he found that there was no hand there. He would try to look at the rest of his body, but all he found was thin air. Carl looked back at the nurse, who wore a smile that lurked between sinister and angelic. The nurse spoke, "How was that, Carl? Still think this is a dream?" Carl shook his head and he looked on with wonder how the woman knew he was indeed shaking his head, when in his own perspective, he couldn't see himself. "Want me to explain so that your human psyche can understand?" Carl nodded.

"Two nights ago, you came into contact with ... something you saw fall out of the sky. You touched it and hours later, you were visited by a woman, but her strength was like a superhuman. You fell out of your apartment, crashing into a police car parked down below. That woman left, but I can no longer sense her presence. A pedestrian called 911 and the same two police officers found your body on the car. Even though you had minor cuts and abrasions, you were perfectly fine when you arrived here at this hospital.

"Now the truth. What you came into contact with was my craft and using my life force, imbued my soul into you. This is why you can hear me, but are unable to see me. With my soul, I have given you powers, which wasn't mine to begin with. I am an alien from a faraway galaxy. Like you, I am a criminal, a fugitive, somewhat of a rebel. I stole the technology that gives you my powers and how the technology works or looks like is even beyond my intelligence. But in your hands, you can use them to your advantage. Imagine, robbing a bank without the use of intimidation, violence or firepower. All it takes is to use your powers and you leave with the riches. Right now, you are using one of my powers. In a limited distance, you can leave your body and inhabit the body of another. The rules are, you must leave your body in a safe place, for if your physical body dies, you die while in your invisible form. Another drawback is that you are more exposed when not in a body, so keep this in mind when that woman, the one who is looking for the technology I stole, is around, for since I can see her, she can see you too, so be careful. Fortunately, i don't sense that woman around, so go out and try my powers for yourself. Don't worry, I'll let you know if your body is in danger or if they move it somewhere else."

Carl tried hard to listen to the explanation of the specific power the voice was telling me about. It sounded simple, but the rules made it complicated. So, I can possess anybody within a certain distance of my body? Carl asked himself. There are several individuals within the immediate vicinity. Who should he try his power on first?

1153.content:
Carl didn't know quite what to think at that moment, aliens, body possession, and worse...the police. With a loud groan Carl then relaxed back on his bed as the Head Nurse carried on with her job, seemingly unaffected by the event a few moments ago. Carl gave some thought into taking the Nurse's body for himself...just for a quick spin, but he decided against it. He glanced to the entrance to the ward, hoping that the gay nurse wouldn't return. Just then the bell ran that signaled the start of Visiting Hours, and several family members of other patients began flowing through the door.

Carl inspected each person as he or she came through the door, and then he turned his attention to the other male patients around him, most of whom were not visible due to a number of drawn curtains. There were two other men about the same age as he was, one with a broken leg (Carl knew he was obviously of no use) and one with some kind of head wound, covered by a light, crepe bandage. But Carl's eyes soon turned to the woman sat by the man's bed, obviously a female acquaintance. There was nothing special about her, in fact she was quite ordinary in appearance. She was pretty for sure, and stood just over 5' 3", her light brown hair was tied back in a ponytail and she was dressed in a lilac-colored, shoulder-strap top, a pair of jeans and a pair of brown leather ankle boots with 3-inch block heels. The most notable thing about was her breasts, Carl estimated their size at a 30G (U.S size).

Carl relieved that's all she had said. He feels hungry as soon as he heard breakfast, but there's something in mind to hold him rush out the room.

He walked back to the laptop, and start searching information about Jacob Harlan's firm. Can't know nothing if he tried to go to work there, like which building, what floor, what exactly Jacob does there. He found their website, with photos helped him identified the building, with address at least knew which floor, and under Jacob's introduction, seemed like he's in charge of... "Real Estate Law Department?" How come Jacob was only in charge of minor department?

His father was the founder, currently in charged of Harlan and Sons' headquarter, located in other state. His brother was with their father, in charged of Criminal Law Department, which the firm best known for. And yet Jacob has so different treatment, in charge of Real Estate Law in their division. Was Jacob an outcast? The rotten apple in his family? Whatever, Carl thought it's a good thing, because he won't have to face Jacob's family on work, less people he have to act around. But was that also mean Carl's miserable life has nothing to do with Jacob?

Not much else to know, Carl closed the laptop and decided it's time to go downstairs. He picked up wallet, phone, and other personal things, opened the door, and saw a woman in maid uniform standing at the side. "Morning, Mister Harlan. Sorry to disturb you like that, it just usually you were eating breakfast downstairs by now." Said the maid, while she took a look at what's Jacob wore then choose a pair of leather shoe from shoe rack at the side to match his outfit, and helped Carl wore it. Carl then remembered he left his shoe outside the room last night, which must be cleaned and put back in the rack by the maid, but more importantly, he didn't even aware he did that last night.

By what the maid said, looked like Carl has spent more time than Jacob usually did. "It's okay, thanks for remind. Wouldn't want to be late to work, would we?" Carl responded with a smile while walking towards the stairs, not sure if he overdone this small talk than Jacob before. "Of course, sir. Have a good day." the maid didn't sound surprised, then she walked into Jacob's bedroom. She must be in charge of room cleaning too, Carl thought.

Carl already smelled the food half way through the stairs. It's not the first time Carl stepped in Jacob's kitchen, but under the bright sunlight, everything looked clearer than last night, and he's impressed by how good the quality. The wooden chair, the marble table, some high-tech stove that cook things without fire, and some decorations either antique or artsy. He glanced outside the french window, there's also some people working on the pool and yard, waved at him when they saw him stared.

There's a man in chef uniform standing next to the stove, watching the TV news. "Morning, sir." he greeted at Carl as he saw him walked to the dining table. Carl nodded then sat in front of the meal. Seemed like Jacob is not a harsh boss, the staffs seemed relaxed around him but also respected him. But also not a very friendly boss, the staff may make small talk, but leave him alone most of the time.

Carl surprised that the breakfast was less and ordinary, like some typical diner's meal, came with salad, scrambled eggs, sausages, beans, and a disgusting green-color juice. The fact that rich people like Jacob preferred ordinary food too, make Carl felt connection to Jacob over this little thing. Sure, he still rich enough to hire a chef to make all these instead of eating at diner. He thought since Jacob has chef, he would ate something fancy, something Carl never ate or even knew how to spell. And the other thing is, it's clearly not enough to fill Jacob's stomach. With that green juice as a clue, was Jacob on diet? Well, Carl can't suddenly changed Jacob's menu if he want to stay low by act like Jacob, so whatever it is he better finished it.

"... the specialist said, the meteor's radiation was very low, the neighborhood should not be worried... " Apparently the reporter in the TV was talking about last night. Carl began to absorb his food while distracted by the news, didn't even realized his mix and confused eating manners in other people's eye. Like, he did put napkin on his laps gently, something he never did before; then he cut his food sometime small to chew lightly, sometime big and try to fill up his mouth like savages, at the same time he's somehow managed to avoid getting grease on his clothes. He never bothered dirt on clothes that much before.

"...a man who claimed he saw the meteor before they retrieved, said the shape was nothing like rock, but a square beaming object." The news continued, Carl's appetite still strong. "... but the spokesman of the institution has denied they obtained any sort of alien object." Of course the government will try to cover it up, Carl not surprised but this time he quite supported them. The less people knew about that strange object, the less worried that people will found out his power.

The rest of news were nothing notable, the meteor didn't even make the headline, just a local news among many others, and the chef sometime added some personal opinion to make some conversation. Suddenly, Carl was interrupted by the phone ringtone. He picked up the phone, it's not someone call him, but just an alarm that Jacob set to ring on 9:30am, with a word 'Work'. Jacob must be very care for punctuality, now his habit helped Carl followed his schedule easily.

Carl haven't finished all his breakfast, but he had to stop and prepared to work. He went cleaned himself a bit by the sink, the chef took this moment to confirm if he should prepared dinner for his employer tonight. Carl not sure but he said yes anyway. Then the chef said goodbye to him as Carl walked out of the kitchen.

Carl saw there's another maid standing at the front door, holding Jacob's briefcase and newspaper. Carl walked near her, adjusted his tie through a mirror by the wall. By now it's already the longest time record of him wearing a tie in his whole life and still counting, he didn't felt uncomfortable but a bit irony. He always mocked those guys that wore suit and tie to work, now he's getting used to be one of them. He took the coat from the rack and the briefcase and newspaper from the maid. The maid opened the front door for him and wish him a safe trip.

Carl remembered where the garage remote control was, he took it out and opened the garage door then jumped back in the car he already familiar with. Up until now, his mind still split. He can either went to Jacob's work and see will he come up with a bigger plan, and he has Jacob's phone and notebook (he found in the briefcase) helped him knew his schedule for the day; Or he can have fun in someplace else since he has Jacob's credit card, and no one in the firm dared to question Jacob's, a partner of the firm, absent.

It's time to make up his mind.
123211111.title: the maid

1232111111.content:
Keep it together, man! Aim High! What kind of criminal are you if you let go the big fish? Carl convinced himself once again. Even getting suspicious, nobody would ever thought such strange power involved! They ain't gonna catch me no more! He took a deep breath, set up the GPS, then drive off to the road. Accepting whatever the next challenge will be.

The road became more busy as he drove into city, to keep the frustration from traffic jam away, he tried to read some pages of Jacob's notebook in between time. He found it from briefcase, along with a pair of reading glass that Carl naturally put it on when he tried to read. This body subconscious thing still spooked him a bit. Anyway, Carl's happy to see how methodically Jacob was, he keep track his schedule in it, and other important notice too. On today he has a meeting with someone, maybe clients. Carl haven't thought of how to face them or avoid them for now. Tomorrow he has an appointment with barber. Seemed easy, but no address or the barbershop name in the note. Then Saturday has golf, Sunday nothing.

It's after 10, His car finally get near the building where the GPS took him, he circle around and found the car park. The guard saw the car and opened the gate without question, let him went straight in. By now the car park was almost full, but just as Carl expected, Jacob has his own parking spot with his name plate. He got out of the car once parked, put on the coat and take the briefcase and newspaper. It's still chill in April's morning.

* * * * *


Carl walked into the building, standing in security line like others, take the pass in briefcase and scan like others, follow the crowd to elevators, like others. If people who knew Carl can recognized him here and now, how very blend in he can be among ordinary people may shocked them more than his shapeshifting power. There's a floor guide near elevator, Carl found out the firm at which floor. There were some people greeted him on his way, and make way for him to go in the elevator.

"After you, sir." a young fella holds the elevator door once they arrived the floor. Carl felt excited and nervous. The first challenge will be finding Jacob's office. There's many people walking around and busy working, he can't looked around like he's first time around here, but then the firm is big and he's not sure which way leads to Jacob's office. He took out the phone and pretend to look at it and walked slowly, that way if he walked into wrong direction, people would think it's because he's too concentrate on the phone. In the mean time he can also tried to unlock the phone, not surprised, Jacob's birthday came in handy again.

After a few wrong turn, he found Jacob's name on a corner office. A young secretary has her table just outside the office greeted him when she saw him came, he immediately thought something dirty on her. Rich guy with pretty secretary, maybe she and Jacob already in 'office romance', let see if I can get lucky today. But for now he just walked into the office.

The office is big enough, and the view outside the windows was spectacular. There's bookcase with a lot of thick book in it, a wooden table with computer and stationery on it, some chair in the center of the room, a sofa, a coat rack he had put the coat on, some plants and decorations, very antique style. Another prove showed how Jacob is so old-fashioned. There's a closet with some spare clothes, and a door leads to personal restroom, no, bathroom, it has shower.

A knock on the door startled him, he quickly sat on the back of the table and answered, "Come in." It's the secretary with a cup of coffee, she put down the coffee on his table, "As usual, sir." "Thank you." Carl pretend to be busy reading the newspaper. The secretary doesn't seemed to send sexual signals. He peeped at her tight covered butt through newspaper as she walked out, felt disappointed. What's wrong is this Jacob guy? Never hit on that thing before? What, was he... gay?

This assumption never occur to Carl until now. This morning he only had time to browse the firm website, doesn't said much about Jacob's personal life. It's time for another internet search. He opened the computer, also password protected, but this time birthday combination doesn't worked its charm. The security was tighter since it's company's computer. Carl thought for a while, took out the notebook again, he remembered he saw something like password in it. And he's right. No matter how tight the security, it's always easier to hack through people's laziness.

Jacob even has some social accounts kept logged in too, save Carl a lot of effort. He looked through all of them quite fast, because Jacob didn't actually put much time on it. His status was single, didn't followed much people, replied a few comments, liked some common articles, no selfie. It's not surprised people like Jacob didn't rely much on internet social. Carl still can't be sure his sexuality, he couldn't describe what his feeling now.

The secretary came in again later, with lots of paper and files, "Mister Harlan, here is the contracts that need your signature. Please have a look. If anything else please let me know." She put them on the table, then smiled away. Whoa, is that what Jacob do all day? Meeting clients and sign contracts? He didn't even have to write or say any lawyer term? Of course the real Jacob would have to read those paper thoroughly to check, but no way Carl's gonna read them all.

Sexuality aside, now Carl focused on figuring out how to fake Jacob's signature. He checked every drawer, and found some document clearly with Jacob's signature. Now only need some practice, but Jacob's signature even better than Carl's handwriting, not an easy job for Carl. Before he started, a knock on the door distracted him again. But this time that person on the other side of the door didn't wait Carl's respond, he straightly opened the door and let himself in.

He looked younger than Jacob, thinner, shorter and wear smarter, look much sunny, sharped and energized than Jacob. Carl happened to see his face this morning, but couldn't remembered his name. "Hey, Jake. Heard you came in late today, well, late for your standard." He lie down on the sofa, "Having fun on the blind date last night?" Carl was accessing the firm's website, and find the page where he saw this guy.

"Uh, no, Mike, she left early because of family emergency." Carl said. Michael Stewart, a partner of this division too, in charge of Criminal Law department, and quite surprisingly, same age with Jacob. Since he addressed Jacob in nickname basis, Carl think they must be more than just partners of a firm, may be friends. He didn't know what the blind date he was talking about, but since Jacob was alone last night in the store, the date must not went well, also explained his temper then. And he tried to slip 'she' in the conversation to see Mike's reaction.

"Again? Keep that up, I started to wonder whether are you purposely sabotaged these dates. I mean, with your wealth, at least you can get some one night stand, how many YEARS since you got laid last time? Before Obama? Or..." Mike kept talking. Carl kinda relieved that now he knew him and Jacob shared same sexuality. He didn't interrupted Mike, the less he engaged the less he said something wrong. He used the time to learn Jacob's signature, he's not a quick learner, but thanks to the subconscious thing again, he mimic it successfully only after a few practice.

"... I mean, you had let go of your ex-fiance thing already, right? Sure she's almost conned her way up just for your money, estranged you and your family, which by the way, you wouldn't have met your savior, me, if you didn't came here." He smirked. "But shouldn't years of therapy sessions healed your fear-of-women phobia already?" Suddenly Mike answered so many questions in just a few sentences. So that's why Jacob has ring mark but no ring, why the guy has everything but girls, why he worked here but not with his family.

"Still too soon? Jake?" Mike noticed Carl, the man he think is Jacob, didn't respond the whole time, thought Carl mad at him joked around his life. "Yeah, it's only noon, my 'savior'." Carl still shocked of what he learned, but tried not to show on his face and pretended to read a contract. "Oh you poor thing, how about some drinks, my treat. Any plan later?" Mike stand up. "Well, a 2 o'clock meeting." Carl remembered from Jacob's notebook.

"Just leave it to your underlings, that's why we hired them. You know you don't have to supervise everything, right? Have some faith in your employee." He continued his persuasion, "And you are a partner in here nonetheless, who else you still have to prove? If you don't exercise your rights once in a while, you gonna make other partners look bad." Mike was such a bad influence for Jacob, obviously.

The offer was very tempting. Mike's not only provided free drinks, but also an excellent idea to avoid the meeting he don't know how to handle, and perhaps he can get more information about Jacob from Mike. But on the other hand, the meeting aside, Carl assumed Jacob was not a person who will ditch the work, accept this offer may make him look less in Jacob character, something that he somehow started to care.
1232111111.title: Go to work

12321111111.content:
"Okay." Carl accepted. "Really? Finally!" Mike invited Jacob several times, but Jacob always chose work. They only knew for few years, they have very different personality, but somehow they became friends. It's harder to make friend when you're in higher place, people always seemed to have some agenda when they get close to you. So Mike very valued Jacob as his truthful friend, seeing his friend working so hard, he always tried to help him lighten up as much as he could, not because of he's boss' son.

But Mike would never thought that the Jacob sat in front of him now was not the friend he knew, even Jacob/Carl unearthly agreed to ditch work now, he thought it just his effort finally moved him. "It's a date then, don't tell my wife. Pick you up at one. No back out, or I will be seeing you in court." Mike added, feared that his friend might changed his mind later. "On second thought, tell Amy. She wouldn't believe me if I told her you finally ditched work and drank at working hour with me." Then he walked out of Carl's office.

Since the schedule has changed, Carl thought he should gave instruction to his employee. He doesn't know which button on the phone can called the secretary, so he walked out and asked her to come inside. "I have to leave early today, something important came up with Mi.. uh, Mr. Stewart." Carl said to her. "So about the 2 o'clock meeting, could you tell others to handle by their own?" He took some risk and assumed Jacob is not the only lawyer who will attend the meeting. "Alright, sir. Have fun." either the secretary was eavesdropping, or Mike's a big mouth. Carl chuckled as she walked out.

Still has some time to kill. Carl signed all the paper, not gonna read them. Beside sweet sleep last night, he finally has some time to really relaxed his mind since all these bizarre things happened. He stood in front of the windows, hands on his hips, looking at the skyline outside, his heart still pounding from all the new things. He couldn't help but to admit, he's kinda enjoyed being Jacob Harlan. The revenge plan became less and less in mind by now. He stretched his suit, adjusted his tie and collar, feel the fabrics again and again. He's not become obsessed about suits, just that this is a simple way he can feel everything still very real, not a dream. Was it worth to destroy all this good things for some revenge if instead I can enjoy them in a long time? I could do much worse than Jacob Harlan.

He started to think maybe he shouldn't waste this opportunity, a complete makeover of his life. Jacob's body was not in best shape, but Carl's old body wasn't good either, he could start working out if he want; Shoving Jacob's work to his staff and signed, doesn't seemed hard too; He could spend Jacob's wealth not necessary as Carl, and less risky if as Jacob himself. Of course he no longer seen his own face in reflection, lost about 12 years of his age, but what goods had came out from his old life? What else would he missed? No family, no friends, many enemies, poor and miserable.

Speaking of old life, the real Jacob would eventually showed up. Maybe no one would ever believe him, but he could still caused some troubles. Even he can find someone to stalk him, then what? Kidnap and send him far far away? Threaten him not to come near him? Or... make him 'disappeared'? Although Carl has been a criminal in most of his life, he never killed a man before, that's his bottom line. So, until things got completely out of control, Carl won't considered that, even if he can hire people to do the dirty work.

"Knock knock, you ready?" Mike showed up right about time, seemed unusually excited just for a drink. Carl also happy to finally get a drink too, it's almost a day since his last beer, if he's still in his old body he will start to withdraw. But he already assumed Jacob is not an enthusiast, so he has to dial down the excitement, "Let's get it over with." Carl said plainly while put on his coat and pick up the briefcase. "Admit it, you're excited too. I can see it in your face!" Mike patted Carl on the shoulder.

They walked out of the building, Mike led him to a car with chauffeur opened the backseat door for them. "Wait, what about my car?" Carl asked. "You didn't have driver, we're going to drink, and you want to drive yourself home after? I'll take you home, and tomorrow give you a ride, how about that?" Mike suggested, Carl nodded. "Since we're on the subject, what's the deal with you didn't want a chauffeur, and only has one car? Saving money for your future kids college fund?" Mike continued, Carl wondered too and gave the best excuse he can thought of, "I like to drive. And I haven't expand my garage."

The drive was not far, the car stopped in front of a restaurant only a few blocks distance from the firm. It's lunch time, tables almost full but Mike has booked a booth. The waiter gave them menu as they sat down, Carl couldn't believed the price, even he can afford now. He ordered a steak, and Mike ordered something in french and a bottle of wine. "Didn't you said your doctor wants you to take care of your cholesterol or something?" Mike always found something to start conversation, "Well, I... uh... the doctor said I can reward myself once in a while." Carl‘s wittiness helped him a lot.

Over the next two hour, they ate many courses of meal, drank many wines. Although Carl preferred beer, the wines are not bad too, maybe because Jacob's tongue more familiar with wine. Mike carried most of the conversation, and the wines, during the time. He complained but not really complained of his family, accidentally revealed things about Jacob, talked about games last night, something and someone at work. Carl mostly pretend to concentrate on his meal, part of him didn't have to pretend too because of light breakfast this morning, but he also chipped in the conversation sometime.

After a bottle turned to a few bottles of wine, Mike's drunk. Carl didn't drank as much as Mike, feared he might said or do something stupid if drunk, but he's kinda impressive that Jacob's body can handle liquor better than his old body. "Never seen you drank that much, t- thought you can't hold up like me." Mike surprised too but not suspected, he stopped drinking once he noticed he's drunk, it took a lot of self-control to stop at his drunken stage. He paid the check with huge tips and then they walked out the restaurant. Carl has to support Mike to the car.

"No no no, Amy will k-kill me if... if she sees me like this." Mike suddenly mumbling something after the car started to drive. "Robert, t- take us to Jake's house first." "Yes sir." Robert the chauffeur replied. "Jake," Mike then turned and looked at Carl with goofy eyes, "this- is important, let me stay a few hours in your house to- be sober enough." Nope, not self-controlled, turned out he's just whipped. "Fine by me." Carl's tried to be a good friend like Jacob.

It's after five when the car arrived at Jacob's house, Carl and the chauffeur, Robert, carried Mike to the front door. A maid opened the door, "Good to see you, sir, you're home early. Oh, what happened to Mister Stewart?" "Drunk. Anything in the house can help him sober up?" Carl told the maid while he and Robert took Mike to the living room. "Yes, we have, sir. Let me get it for you." the maid quickly ran to the kitchen.

Robert put down his master gently on a sofa, then he said he will be waited at the car. Carl followed him to the front door, as he opened the door, a woman was standing right in front. The woman make way for Robert to get out. She's a very fine looking woman, young, long blonde hair, wore sexy but not hooker like. She waited the chauffeur walked far, then turned to Carl and said...
12321111111.title: Carl & Mike Go to Drink

123211111111.content:
"Hello, Mr. Carl Edwards." She said with a smile. "Wha- What did you call me?" Carl panicked. He never met this woman before, even if he did, how did she knew he's Carl when he looked like Jacob? Who is she? What did she knew? How did she knew?

"Relax, we both know who you really are, Mr. Edwards. " She's still smiling, like no big of the deal, "I will explain everything, if you give us some privacy, like, send your staff home." She's alone, her body much smaller than Carl's, and her clothes didn't seemed to able to hide any weapon. Carl thought a while, then he told the maid who just gave Mike some medicine and towel, "Something came up, I need you and others leave early today, clear the house now, come back tomorrow." The maid worried, but Carl reassured her it is not something bad, she hesitated but off to tell others.

The staff said goodbye to Carl hurriedly, the chef even left a half-cook fish on a pan. As soon as the last one leave and closed the door, he went into the living room where the woman was waiting. He saw her hold something like lipstick and sprayed some purple mist on Mike's nose, he inhaled. "What are you doing?" Carl's too late to stop her. "Some precaution, making sure he's asleep and won't wake up anytime soon." The lipstick thing disappeared from her hand when Carl‘s not looking. "Done? Talk." Cal's mind was in a whirl, he needed answers very much, very soon.

"Cut to the chase, huh? I like it. First, let me introduce myself. My name is Alice, I'm what you human called an alien." Carl didn't expect he really got a straightforward answer, also a very out of space answer. "Alice is the name of this body I copied." She pointed to herself.

Carl didn't know how to react, his face very blank. "You shouldn't be so shocked, after all, you think the device you touched that granted you these abilities can be earth made?" Her voice sounded sweet the whole time, but her words make Carl uneasy, "Let me start from the top."

"It's been hundred of years since life form from outer space come visit earth. Aliens from different planet, with different technology. Of course we don't call ourselves aliens, just wants you to understand easier." She added. "We have rules not to disturb the under developing planet when visiting. Aliens come here because of different reason, from research to vacation. We have authorities in charge, giving something like visa, not like anyone can come and go anytime and do whatever they want."

"But we are not saint, having advanced technology doesn't mean we won't make mistakes, things happened, good or bad. Whether is trying to take over your world by using secret weapon, or accidentally leave marks on desert. We are much advanced than human, but we can't undo time. Yet. If happened, happened."

"We still do damage control. Some may never even heard as rumors, some make a huge part of history of your world, depend on how far we handled." Carl interrupt her, "You mean... kill everyone who's involved?" She laughed a bit, "Depends, some aliens are aggressive, mines are not. The rules are flexible once thing already happened, any trick will do as long as not making another chaos."

"While we here, we have several options to blend in or hide among human, transformation device is one of them. It's a hot selling item in our planet, very suitable for people who want to come here for vacation." Buy now for only $29.95, tax not included. Carl added in mind. Though everything he heard was way over his head, but getting answers helped him calmed down, even can jokes around a bit, "Long story short, one of our people accidentally dropped his device to the earth, we traced it back to you, and here we are. "

"So, you mean the device transformed my body? But I didn't took it with me, and the transformation didn't took place around that device." Carl responded honestly, no point to lie. If she's the enemy, she didn't have to explain all this to him. "Ah, that's one of the reason why we approach to you rather than just kill you in the sleep." She said what he thought out loud, a scary coincidence.

"Like I said just now, different planet has different technology." She started another explanation. "Our technology, is a combination of science and what human called, magic. Those elements of magic exist in earth too, but only a few human know how to use them, and mostly used it on spiritual thing, what a waste if you asked me. For us, we found a way to combine both. We extracted them, learned them, controlled them, used them, but we didn't fully understand them too."

"This is the part we find it fascinating. The device was malfunctioned after it fall from such altitude. But when you touched it, somehow the magic elements transferred into your body. The device was designed for us, nothing like that ever happened to our people. We think it's because human and us have different body structure, so it affects differently. We analyzed your body last night..."

"What?! what the fuck did you do to my body?" Carl complained. "Yeah, we actually found you last night, after we retrieved the device and replace it with a rock before more human saw it. Following the trail of the magic element to this house was quite easy, even if you can't see it. We waited you to sleep and scanned your body, nothing harmful. We also extracted your memory and pieced everything together. That's why we know who you really are."

"Anyway, nothing unusual other than the magic element in your body, we didn't find the answers we're looking for, like how did you control and use it without the device. It took some time for us to decide whether or not to ask your cooperation for further study, then we waited until the timing is right to contact you with less witness."

"Here's the deal. We have bureaucracy too. The permits to do experiment on human is hard to get in a short time, but if we can make it as a cooperation, sign a deal for win-win situation, it could makes the paperwork move faster and easier. The deal will be like allowed us to monitor your power in action, take anything necessary for research but won't harm you in any way. At the same time, we provide anything we can for you if you need anything, keep you safe and not disturb your any action, unless it could kill other people. If the research caused human dead, the authority has the power to shut it down. We could be banned from earth."

Alice's hand suddenly appeared a device that looked like tablet, "Here's the details, put your palm here if you agreed the terms after you read it." Carl took over the tablet, saw the deal was written in English, but he's lazy to read it. "What if I said no?" Carl only curious about this. "Well, either wait for permits to abduct you, or we will try to extract all the magic element in your body, and wiped your memory about all of this. To be honest, the element has become very attached to your organs, we can't 100% sure if we get them out by force, you will still be alive."

It didn't sound like he had a choice at all. Carl's mind filled with confusion and chaos, but he's not stupid. Without much thought, he put his hand on the tablet. Alice took the tablet back, checked it, look satisfied. "Sorry we don't have time to prepare a celebration ceremony. Now, since we have a deal, can you demonstrate your power for us the first time?" Alice suggested. "Us? But I only see you." "Oh, we had put surveillance around you and your places, other than the bedroom, my colleagues are watching us this whole time." So they knew I will say yes eventually. Asking me was just some formality.

"You can try it on this man." She pointed at Mike, who still sleeping on the sofa. "He won't remember a thing in this condition. Or, do you have someone else in mind? We can try to get him, or her, to you." Carl didn't expected she will offer him something like that, "Didn't you mentioned before something like aliens are prohibited to involve in human world?" "Yes. Here's a little tricky, we can't, but you can. Those rules don't applied on you, since you are human. We simply provide 'material' you requested like in the contract, what you did to the material is out of our hand, as long as you didn't kill them." Her smile turned sinister.

She continued, "Before you said you want president of your nation or someone like that, we are not able to just kidnap anyone too. We can't let human sees us, every kidnap must be discreet. Those alien abduction story you heard are bad examples, if we want to abduct human, no one would ever suspected. Your world nowadays surrounded many surveillance system, especially the man in higher power has more security. We can zapped the person in a second, but if the person disappeared an hour or so, may become national security issue. So let's be real on your choice."

Carl remembered the first time he shapeshifted, it was painful. If he wants to use it now, he needs some time to rest before another transformation. So the choice of the next person is important too, he wants to stay as that person for a couple of days. Mike's not a bad choice, he saw his beautiful wife's photo, he had know little things about him through the lunch, sure he has a teenage son who hits adolescence maybe a downside, but overall his life can considered better than Jacob, and he's here already. But on the other hand, it is the opportunity he can choose someone else who he can't reach easily, maybe from other state or even other country.

"So, your decision is?" Alice asked again, Carl's answer was...
123211111111.title: A Close Encounter

1232111111111.content:
It's getting dark outside, Carl didn't noticed until Alice mentioned it, "Look at the time, I hoped we can finish our first test before bedtime. We have to sleep and rest too." He couldn't think of any other names in the short time, and Mike's not a bad choice and available.

"Before I start, I have a question." He stand next to Mike, "Is my power has a limit amount to use?"
