Carl didn't want to mention what Alice said before about memory confusion, and Alice didn't said anything now too.

"Here we go." Carl pressed on the confirm button, the tablet shot a beam to Jacob's head, Jacob stood still, nervous of what will happened to him. But he felt nothing even after the beam was gone. "How do you feel? Anything different? Mike?" Carl asked. "No, nothing really." Jacob answered. "Let's try something. Remembered our lunch?" "Ya, I had foie gras and you ordered steak." "How many bottles of wine we've drank?" "Five I guess, I'm still a bit dizzy, you should've stopped me." "Have you noticed you referred yourself in Mike's place this whole time?" "What's wrong with that, I am Mi..." Jacob froze and swallowed the rest of the word, he almost lost himself, that scared him the most in these two nights.

"No, I'm Jacob... of course I'm Jacob." He said it mostly to himself. "Welcome back. What happened in your mind?" Carl has to know what consequence he will faced. "I don't know. I didn't feel strange to recall this afternoon as Mike, I know who I am exactly once you pointed out. But just now, I really thought that I am Mike and I'm talking to my friend Jake. It switched so smooth and natural, as if I'm both Jake and Mike at the same time."

Carl kept quiet, let Jacob sort his mind. It's Carl's turn to receive Jacob's memory that he copied just now, but seeing Jacob's reaction, he may have to consider what Alice said was true: received others memory will affect him. But he needed Jacob's memory to live a week, and Jacob still able to remember back who he is after all, maybe he won't be lost like Jacob, maybe his mind was stronger than Jacob's.

Carl must decided quickly, it's almost 8pm, they have to wrap things up as soon as possible. Should he use the memory device on himself or not?
1232111111111111.title: Three Is Not a Crowd

12321111111111111.content:
Jacob almost finish dressing, he has wore the pants, shoes and suits, he's now tying the tie. Using other person's hands had make him a bit clumsy, but his moves were a lot smoother after receiving Mike's memory, like he always knew how to use proper strengths, but Jacob didn't notice this small change.

Carl decided to complete Mike's transformation first. He scanned his own brain into the tablet himself, then copied all his memory. He cut out these two days memory from the copy, make sure the copy doesn't have anything start from seeing the meteor. By now Jacob has finished up his look, with wedding ring, wallet, and other Mike's possessions. He looked at himself in the mirror again, this time with Mike's clothes. Carl knew his feeling, confused and excited, but Jacob maybe also has a bit guilty about his friend.

"If you finished, dress Mike with your previous clothes." Carl said. Jacob followed order without hesitation this time, he knew there's no point to show disregard by the time he dressed himself as Mike, whether he wanted or not, he is an accomplice now. Carl finished memory edit, then shot the beam to Mike's head. "How do you make sure he won't remember he's Mike?" Jacob asked while busy and a bit embarrassed of dressing up other guy. "Easy, I had cut out his Mike's memory instead copy, his brain was blank. And since the memory has transferred to you, you are the only one that has Mike's memory. Now he had received my memory, without these two days memory, he will think he's Carl without knowledge of all this. In conclusion, he is Carl, you are Mike." Jacob didn't feel much conflict as he heard Carl called him Mike again.

"By the way, how did you get these clothes from my place? I don't think I have my current address in my wallet." Carl asked after the beam was stopped, and he then helped Jacob dressing Mike. "I... er... I'm not sure. I woke up in the hospital this morning, freaked out, but I pretended I'm all fine, checked myself out. I had no idea where should I go, just wondering the street while dealing a lot of questions in mind. Before I realized, I was standing in front of an old apartment building, and when I walked up the stairs and corridor, somehow I knew which door I could open. This is where I found some least dirty clothes that I can changed into." Carl knew what he experienced, but he can't explained the subconscious thing like Alice, so he just listened.

"...I can't find any food, I have no money, yet I found a subway pass." Jacob continued. "Yeah, I stole it some time ago." Carl added. "Anyway, I used it to came this neighborhood, but I don't know how to approach, and I knew that my look will get attention if I stayed too long around here. So I decided to back to your apartment, at least less cold than outside before figured things out. You know the rest, I got kidnapped by alien." They finished dressed up Mike.

Carl asked Alice to transferred Mike to his apartment, and put on a surveillance for caution. "I can't put surveillance, but-" before Alice finished her sentence, Carl continued for her, "Yeah yeah, but I can, because of galaxy law's loophole. Jake, watch the house, we will be back soon." Before Jake wanted to protest that this is his house, Alice started the transportation, a bright light make Carl shut his eye, and when the light gone within seconds, he's back in his hellhole. The mess, the smell, the dirt, all same as before but he felt more disgusted now.

Alice handed him a small device, it's like a camera and instructed Carl to put on the ceiling. Carl did as she said, the device stick and became invisible. They put Mike on the floor, Carl looked at his body one last time this close. Some might thought something like 'life sucks, but better sucks in own life', those people must be never tasted how low can life be. Carl couldn't wait to ditch his old life, not a single thing he will missed. "Push this button, this will cancel out the sleeping mist." Alice took out the spray and aimed at Mike's nose while teaching Carl, this time it sprayed yellow mist, "We better leave now, he could be wakes up soon."

After another light, Carl and Alice were back to Jacob's living room. Jacob put on a smile when he saw them, but froze as he found that odd too. Carl figured out what could it be, "Thought happy to see your friend Jake again for a second, weren't you? MIKE." Jacob didn't opposed, Carl smirked. "How's Mike? Is he really fine?" Jacob tried to change subject. "Let's see, here's the monitor." Alice took out another tablet thinner and flexible than previous device. The screen showed Carl's apartment, Mike has woken up, mumbling "Fucking headache." "I thought it's still fucking noon." "How the hell did I came home?" and something like that while walking around.

Jacob didn't feel any relieved when he saw Mike's reaction, Carl noticed his sadness, "I bet Mike never cursing like that, right? He's Carl Edwards now, and he won't recognizes you or himself, he won't upset about what he missed, because he didn't remember a bit. Let him be, that's Carl who live in Carl's life, not Mike." And it's time for Carl to become Jacob Harlan too. He turned off the screen for not to let Jacob lost into his guilt, and took the memory device to start operate. Then a beam shot into his head, there's no turning back now.

"Seemed like everything's in place, Mr. Edwards, I'll leave the rest in your hands." Alice said, but it took Carl a moment to realize she's talking to him, he's Mr. Edwards, "These devices are solar-charge, don't let them fall into other people's hand." "Sure, I won't." Carl answered politely. Maybe I can use these devices to help Mike escape... No, that's Jacob's thinking! Carl almost drawn into how Jacob thinking as Alice continued, "I won't meet you often, but you can call us anytime, just shout out. You're under surveillance, but we leave some privacy in this house, like bathroom and bedroom. I think that's about it, goodbye, Mr. Edwards." "Goodbye, Alice." Carl being very polite again.

As Alice disappeared in a bright light, Carl turned to Jacob and said, "Well then, you should head home too, Mike." This time, he called Jacob as Mike was not joking around but a sincere mistake, that's how confusing. "Amy called, remembered? Better get our story straight. I told her that you and I were drinking and I'm drunk, so you carry me home." Now's a mixture of Carl's memory with Jacob's concern for his friend. Jacob looked at his watch, he frowned, "Oh my god, that late already? Amy's gonna kill me." Whether is the fear had put him into character or not, he had to face it as Mike anyway.

Jacob didn't want to waste time on clear up whose mind it is, he wouldn't want to worry his --Mike's-- wife. "Don't messed up my life, Carl." "Start get use to call me Jake, Mike." They walked out the front door, the chauffeur open the back door when he saw them. "Well, goodbye, Jake." Jacob had to call Carl by Jake as a third person was around, but he didn't rejected as much as he thought might be, even a bit cheerful like Mike would do. "See you tomorrow, Mike." And Carl responded like Jacob too.

Carl closed the door as Jacob walked towards the car. What a day! Carl started to feel the exhaustion. But haven't done much work today, I can squeeze some time to do before bed... Wait, what was I thinking?! Jacob's workaholic personality slipped in. He also knew what works Jacob do now, and almost about to start making a schedule to catch up the work he left, no, the work Jacob's left today, but stopped as he realized that's not how Carl's think, no, how he think. Referred myself as third person, first step to lose my mind. It's only been less than an hour since he received Jacob's memory, and he already felt much more exhausted to keep separate his and Jacob's mind. Maybe that's a good thing, he's living in Jacob's life now after all, maybe I should go with the flow. It's getting late, let's keep the strength for tomorrow.

He put all the alien devices into his briefcase, luckily they all small enough. Then he ate some cookies, he knew exactly where they were, as simple dinner. He took the briefcase and went to bedroom, and started to put things to where Jacob always put, like jacket to hanger, watch and wallet on cabinet, phone on the counter at the side of the bed and charging it. And then he took a bath, unlike last time, he didn't find it strange to see his naked body, and his cleaning process was different too.

It's 9:30pm only, he didn't changed to pajamas after bath, instead of polo and khakis, added the suit jacket if still felt a bit chilled with the heater. Even nobody's watching and only some times left before bed, Jacob still wore decently at home. Carl couldn't bothered much anymore, just went with it. But when his mind tried to tell him to work, he fought back and went to living room to watch some TV, he can finally relaxed after the tense of these two days, he deserved to enjoy an hour or two.

After being couch potato for only an hour and half, Carl went to bed at 11pm as always, well, as Jacob always. He couldn't even resist to read the novel Jacob's been reading before sleep, wanted to know what happened next to that John Dempsey guy. Jacob always favored military thriller novel. This might be the first time Carl ever read a book very concentrated. Then sleep before midnight on time. Jacob might already felt bored to his life, but Carl tasted for the first time how organized life can be, I have to admit, not so bad. Not bad at all.

After all the ups and downs of Carl's life, turned out all he ever wanted was a normal life, like most people do.
12321111111111111.title: Carl Jacob Edwards Harlan

123211111111111111.content:
The next morning, Carl followed Jacob's behavior, more sufficient, more spick and span than yesterday. Like he knew what sock garters are and put it on, he found the look without pants was kinda funny for a second, but then thought it is necessary for hold up socks and he stick to it; or knew to use beard care product, wore cuff links for some shirt, a handkerchief in pocket. Those little things he missed yesterday, but now he knew exactly what to wear.

The staff of his house might thought their boss a bit weird yesterday, like late to work and let them home early, but today they got the usual Jacob Harlan back, like did everything on time and ate elegantly, that's how great job Carl had done. And he's at work early like Jacob usual did, greeted his colleagues by their names on the way to his office. He started to work after reading newspaper, another thing Carl never read before.

He drafted some paperwork, read through documents, ask his lawyers about progress of yesterday's meeting, calling clients, confirmed next week schedule with Jen - his secretary. He knew and spoke the legal terms like he's been learned for years. He didn't even felt like pretending the whole time, surrounded with the atmosphere that's more familiar to Jacob, had amplified his Jacob part. Of course he also felt fresh or weird or surprised of what he's doing occasionally, but the Carl part was definitely appeared less.

He didn't saw Jacob, as Mike, the whole day. Mike usually would visited Jacob's office to chat with his friend two or more times a day. Now that Jacob was Mike, Carl understood why he didn't followed this Mike's behavior. He even went to barber alone followed Jacob's schedule, usually Mike would happy to tag along just to sneak out from work. Mike's very good at his work, just sometime behaved like child.

Carl came home after work, did everything like Jacob would in front of his staff. But as soon as they gone, Carl tried to find himself back after being Jacob the whole day. He used the free time when Jacob would did some more work to do things he like, called it Carl Time. He won't admit what Alice said about memory-affects-mind thing, but after whole day being Jacob, he's not that stubborn anymore. He must at least take some time to do something he liked, to remind himself who he really is.

Since it's Friday, Carl decided to go to a bar. He drove to a bar at downtown he heard but never went before, a bar that sold $4 beer at $15, but that's not a matter to him anymore. Jacob not a fan of beer, which is why his house didn't have any. And that's why Carl eager to find some beer, because that's also mean this is definitely his own decision, not Jacob's. But he still gave in on responsibility, only drank enough to still able to drove back later. And Jacob's low confident stopped him hitting on girls too. Well, two days without beer, he might as well enjoyed his beer alone for now.

* * * * *


The golf event was in a country club. It's about business, making relations with clients and lawyers, exchanging information, discussing about finance and other topics that can bored Carl to death, while playing a little golf. Jacob's memory also told him he's bored too, but he had to do it for work... Wait, I could just choose not to come in the first place? All too late now, at least Jacob's memory helped a lot the whole time, like who he knew, what to say, where to go, how to golf. Carl did enjoyed sometime too.

Jacob came too, he greeted to Carl like Mike usually did to Jacob when in public, but he still tried to avoid Carl as much as he can. Carl didn't forced him, but now he can observed him in short distance, seeing him interact with other people, Jacob definitely done a great Mike too. Jacob's not bad in socializing, but he's not as good as Mike. Make people laughed, knew the timing and mood, Mike can easily be the center of the crowd, which is what Jacob achieved now. But Jacob's not the only person he observed, Carl picked out candidates of his next life too, making a list in his mind.

He went to bar at night again. This time he hit on some women, awkwardly. He's not good at it while he's still Carl, he's terrible now added Jacob's fear of women. Apparently Jacob's ex-fiancee/con artist left a big scar in his heart. Carl did tried to thought about it, but all he got was sadness and almost cried out loud. Jacob still has some feeling for her, but Carl swore he's not gonna let this ruined his sex life, he would get what he wanted eventually.

* * * * *


Sunday came, Carl went to the mall shopping. He bought some clothes he like to wear when he's himself, like jeans, but also suited for Jacob's look. He didn't plan to stay as Jacob for long, but he thought these little change would helped him stayed Carl. He also bought a small bag for the devices, easy to carry around. He also tried to find next body in the mall, teenagers, happy family, or picked by appearance, doing that let him figured what he really wanted.

* * * * *


Monday, Carl went to work as usual. Huh, 'as usual'. Only five days and I already adapted this lifestyle as my own.

Most surprised was, Jacob came to him. "Hey, Jake, got a minute?" Jacob entered his office and said in Mike's lively tone, while the door still opened, can't be too cautious. "Morning, Mike." Carl said in Jacob's tone. As soon as Jacob closed the door, he tuned down his Mike's characteristic, "Carl, right?" Not sure why he asked that, "Yeees?" Carl responded with curious. Jacob seemed relief from what he was worried, then lay on the couch like Mike usually did, but quickly stood back up.

"Anything wrong?" Carl stopped his work and asked. Jacob's face, or Mike's face, showed some fear. "I, er... I don't know where to start," Jacob sat on the chair in front of Carl, "You know the memory thing? It's convenient, too convenient. These few days I acted like Mike, live exactly as Mike. And sometime... most of the time, I forgot who I really am. I thought I can differentiate whose mind it is, but Mike's life took over me. I become more chatty, I like to watch sport games, I write left-handed, I..." Jacob hesitated, then continued, "I had sex with Amy." Amy was Mike's wife. "Whoa, tell me everything." Carl teased him. "It's not funny, I had sex with my friend's wife! I know it's wrong, but it's our- no, their routine, and I- she- I- " "You gave in Mike's mind at that moment, doing his duty as husband." Jacob can't argued with that. "Look at this way, technically your body are Mike's, so the sperms you produced should still be Mike's if she conceived." "You sure?" "Try not to overthink it, just enjoy."

"Anyway, I know what you've been through. I constantly lost in your mind when around people too." Carl tried to change subject so Jacob won't stayed guilt, "So I've created a Carl's Time, doing my own thing during that. You can try for yourself." "But I always surrounded by people, colleagues at work, family at home. It's 24/7!" Jacob still a little frustrated. "How about this? Mike always come by to this office. You can use the time as Jacob's Time." Carl said. Jacob considered Carl's suggestion a while, "I supposed I can. Seeing myself might be a good reminder too. Sorry I avoided you before." "Oh really? I didn't noticed." Carl said sarcastically.

* * * * *


Tuesday to Thursday, Carl's life didn't have much to say.

Carl done the work well like Jacob, and Jacob started to come by often. Sometime they talked, making actual conversation, not just about their extraordinary experiences, but also something work related, and, since they shared the same Jacob's mind but different on the extra, they shared opinions on small topics too. They interacted like friends, there were times they were accidentally called each other 'Jake' and 'Mike', and most of times Jacob carry the conversation, like Mike always did. Sometime Jacob just read the novel he hadn't finished when he's himself. Jacob didn't brought up his and Amy again, seemed like sex had overpowered guilt, he's still a man after all.

At Carl's Time, Carl either went to bar, or watched TV, he still has to fight his mind over bringing work to home.

* * * * *


Friday, the one week deal was up.

Carl sat down with Jacob in his office in the morning, they didn't called Alice to this meeting, she didn't showed up in the whole week either. "So, how's the weekly experience, satisfied?" Carl asked, Jacob didn't answered, but he didn't denied too. "Still wants your life back? Or taking our partnership to next level?" Carl asked again. "What exactly is the next level?" "To be honest, I haven't decide yet. We can be anybody, but I haven't figure out what I really want." Carl didn't lie, "But I knew you want to be in military. We can do that first if you want." He has Jacob's memory, and his nightstand novel was an obvious clue.

Jacob's face blushed as someone else has said out loud the wish he had in deep mind. When he's young, he even planned to join the military, but of course his parent wouldn't allowed and sent him to law school, and he caved in. Now his dream can finally came true, though a bit cheated with Carl's power. At the same time, he also knew how dangerous will be, he's not acted by impulse like teenager anymore. And speaking of teenager, he has someone else in mind too. And, he also kinda missed his old dull life too.

Jacob's answer was...
123211111111111111.title: Time Flied

1232111111111111111.content:
"What do you mean by haven't decide what life you want?" Jacob asked. "Well, before I answer that," Carl decided to tell him something, "Can you recall my name, Carl Edwards, from Mike's memory?" Jacob shrugged, "Hmm... no, should I- Mike knows you?"

"Of course he can't, he may never heard about me. I'm just one of the lowlife in hundreds of cases." Carl didn't surprised, "The firm takes pro bono case, right? Few years ago I was represented by Rick, you know, Rick Anderson under your- Mike's department." Jacob nodded. "I was facing burglary charge, the evidence was not solid, but he advised me to take the DA's deal, said the DA might have found hard evidence. So I took the not-so-good deal. Much later, I found out the DA didn't have new evidence like he said, he just helped the DA in exchange of favor."

"But you were guilty, right?" Jacob interrupted. "Maybe, that's not the point." Carl continued, "I have every reason to hate Rick and this firm for sold me out. I thought of using your identity to ruin this firm as soon as I found out who you are. But the thought faded in these couple days. Yesterday I met Rick on the way, we even make some happy small talk. With my power, I can ruined his life easily, but I'm not gonna waste time on getting even." There's a thing that Carl left out, he also thought it's Jacob's mind affected him to be less vengeful.

"I just want to enjoy life from now on, but less work. Your life's fine, but you're too dedicated to work, I'm still amused now, but I'm not sure I will after long time. Maybe find a life that's no need to work at all, and can travel around the world without any worry. I have many ideas but couldn't decide which to focus. Since I'm not in a rush, if you have something, or someone in mind, I can follow your plan first. Maybe after experienced some more different life, I can know what I really want."

Whether feeling guilty or not, Jacob did enjoyed these last few days. His friend, Mike, has what he always dreamed of, a family. But that should be over now. And since Carl offered, why not took this opportunity to live another dream? "Well, I... uh... I did thought of try military." Jacob said in almost whispers, but Carl happy to hear. "Then settled, let's go play soldiers." By now, Carl knew his has succeeded in luring Jacob to his side, even Jacob didn't noticed.

"Let's see... in my Jacob's mind, I knew you always like Navy, right? What rank do you want? Commander? Captain? Maybe even different country's Navy?" Carl started to plan. "I'm more interested in lower rank, do the works first hand." Jacob joined in. "Still workaholic huh? I thought Mike's laziness might rubbed off on you." "What's the point if not enjoy the procedure? By the way, how do we do it? It's not like we can kidnap them from the base." "About that, we have friends, alien friends, remember?"

Then Jacob raised his head and called out Alice name. After few minutes, Alice did appeared. "Hello, Mr. Harlan, Mr. Stewart. Nice to meet you again." She might thought that's hilarious by calling them the body's name. "Yeah, yeah. Look, can you snatch some people for me?" Carl didn't want to waste time to that joke. Alice kinda disappointed that they didn't fall for that, "Other than the real Mr. Stewart, no can do." The answer shocked Carl, "What?! Why? You did took Jake to me before, why not now?"

"We can't just kidnap human, we're not that kind of alien who ignore the law. That time with Mr. Harlan was just because he is already involved. Mr. Stewart is same too. As for someone else, we can't." Alice said calmly. "So... even for research purpose, you still can't help us get any people?" Carl asked again. "That's right. Apply for human snatching will be a lot of paperwork and take months." Alice answered.

"Geez, now you telling us." Carl sighed. He and Jacob silenced, thinking what's the next move. "How about change to someone else." Jacob opened his mouth first, "I always want to be young again." "Young, like teenager? Or child?" Carl intrigued. "Teenager, of course. Don't you ever wish to go back to the time when what you worried most was asked the girl out and homework?" Jacob said, "Well, you know my past. My boarding school life wasn't that interesting, maybe this can be my second chance." Jacob started to excite, "We can sneak into some college party, after they were drunk then we..."

"Or," Carl interrupted, "You can just switch with Mike's son, Adam." Jacob gazed, then suddenly jump up and higher his voice, "You can't do that to my son!" Then he realized what's wrong in his saying, and slowly sat back down. "Calm down, don't let Mike's instinct control you." Carl and Alice were a little shocked by his reaction. Mike must be a good father. "Sorry. Even so, Adam is my friend's son." Jacob tried to sound calm. "Unless you planned to sabotage his life, what's the harm for a few days? He's the easiest target we can find for now, you can switch with his friend later."

Mike's strong fatherly protective aside, Jacob knew Carl has the point. As Mike, he can make some excuse to take 'his' son to work, then they meet up with Carl and let Carl do the rest. Quick and easy. Adam's not a bad choice too, maybe a bit younger than planned. He attended a private school, he's not geeky like Jacob was, but he's not some famous jock either. He didn't have a girlfriend, not that Mike knew of. He's a good kid, though lately he didn't talked much about his life to his parent, but that just maybe adolescence. Mike and his wife respected their son's privacy, but sad about growing distance as he growing up.

As Jacob's mind being taken far from the point by Mike's affection, Carl didn't have the patient to wait for his answer any longer, "So? Are you in?" "Huh? Yeah, I guess." Jacob back to earth, "How about you? It will be weird if 'Jake' meet with his friend's son so often." Carl thought of that too. There are a few people around Adam that he can choose, the easiest one will be Mike. Or Robert, the driver, but definitely not other house staff, too much work. Or... Mike's wife? Carl not sure if he wanted that much life experience... or is he?

Carl's answer will be...
1232111111111111111.title: A Turning Point

12321111111111111111.content:
"The answer is obvious, I'm gonna be Mike." Carl said. This time Jacob didn't opposed like last time, "Figured you would chose him. But promise me, after switch with Adam's friend, please let Mike back to himself." "No problem, at least we can get him whenever we want," Carl turned to Alice, "right?" Alice smiled and nodded.

They continued to make a plan, and set the date on tomorrow, which was Saturday. Then continued the day as Jacob and Mike, and Alice back to wherever she lived. To commemorate the last day as Jacob Harlan, Carl was in full Jacob mode the whole day. He didn't questioned himself whether the thought that came up was his or Jacob's mind, he didn't bothered to correct himself when he really referred himself as Jacob Harlan. And after work back to home, Carl didn't went to bar or watched TV, he done some more work in study room and finished the novel. He even wore a shirt and a sweater vest instead of the clothes that he bought last Sunday.

Next day morning, Carl came to the firm. He went to Jacob's office as planned, and called out Alice to help. "Good morning, Mr. Edwards." Alice showed up quickly, "Are you sad to say goodbye to Mr. Harlan's life soon?" "Well," Carl stretched his arms, "Not much going on in his life, but after living years of frustration, I do enjoy the normal and boredom. And... I hate to admit, but wearing suit and go to work everyday, weren't so bad." Carl don't know why, but he's more opened to Alice than he thought, maybe because Alice has feminine look. "You know," Alice replied, "we checked your past. Do you think the old you would said the same thing?" "What do you mean?" "I mean, is it your mind that came to this conclusion, or you're under influence of Mr. Harlan's mind?" "Slap 'I told you so' to my face, eh? Yes, maybe Jake's kind-heart makes me soft, but maybe that's not a bad thing. Why do I have to feel negative all the time?" Carl admitted human minds are more complicated than he thought.

Alice just stood there and smiled, "If it helped, not only human, all creature's mind are very easy to manipulate once you know how, there's no stronger mind so to speak." She changed the subject, "Anyway, here's the things you asked for." She took out some capsules, "These are our special painkillers, modified for human, won't cause delusion or sleepy or dizziness, but only affects 5 minutes." Then she took out a couple of ball-shape devices, "This is the device that can cancelling noises. Put them on the walls, we'll create a sound proof room." The reason Carl asked for the device, was in case the painkillers won't work. Carl followed her instruction and put those devices on every corner.

After that, Carl took out the memory device from the bag. This was the tricky part. First he cut out Jacob's mind from his brain, feared that the device couldn't differentiate his and Jacob's mind and took all his mind instead, even Alice has reassured him that won't happen. And he glad it didn't happened. Carl still has his mind after the process. He then tried to think something from Jacob, he still remembered some of what he learned from last few days, but other than that, completely clueless about how to do Jacob's work.

But the work's not finished, now he has to add and modify some memories of what he did as Jacob over the last few days, make sure nothing about transformation, make his and Jacob, or 'Jacob and Mike's conversation' looked normal. The device can do that, but that's not an easy job, even Alice was here to assist. Before he finished, he saw the doorknob suddenly turning. Jacob must be arrived with Adam. The plan was Jacob would signaled him as he arrived, but Carl didn't heard a thing this whole time. Luckily he noticed the doorknob, he quickly took out the sleeping spray and ready.

"...come on in, son. This won't take a minute." Jacob said as he walked in. "Hi, Mr. Harlan. How... wha... " As soon as Adam walked in and the door closed, Carl sprayed the mist to his face before he can finished his sentence, then put Adam's body on the couch. "Didn't you said you will signalling me?" Carl asked Jacob. "I did, didn't you heard?" Jacob asked back. "No!... Ah, must be the sound proof device, didn't considered that." Carl thought.

"Alright, " Carl continued his work on memory device, "I just finished the memory modification, let's strip all the clothes." "Uh... before that, can you take out my Mike's memory first? It's so weird to strip own son, and his mind still shout out to save his son from this." Jacob suggested, "And one thing I thought of last night, can you erased some of my memory too?" "I get the first point, but what's the second one for?" Carl finished on memory modification. "Well..." Jacob felt too embarrassed, "I er- I'm about to be Amy's son. I'm not comfortable to still have some memories that...around the bed."

Carl knew what he implied, he laughed, "Afraid of too much mommy issues for therapy? Fine, I will have it anyway." One thing he noticed when he's working on his Jacob's memory that cut out from his brain, that Jacob's memory also included the last few days that Carl became Jacob, but Carl still remembered what he did in these days. That means when he lived as Jacob, the memory was considered as belonged to both of them, which is convenient for him to know what Jacob did as Mike in these last few days too.

Cut out Mike's memory from Jacob was simple, and the work of erase certain memory was easy too, with Jacob pointed out the exact time, while he stripping down Adam's clothes. On the way to the field, Carl and Jacob were tried to adjust with their new roles. They discussed what the next step is, like picked out their next candidates from Adam's memory in Jacob's brain. In between time, Carl decided back to his house, he knew Amy was at home. It's time he could finally has what he wanted after a long time, and he's not gonna felt any guilt like Jacob.

Carl drove the car, a Toyota sedan, as fast as he can without breaking law. Speaking of the car, he thought Mike lived luxury too, but now he knew he actually lived much more simple, even compared to Jacob. They have a suburb house in a good neighborhood, like old-time America dream, and also have a minivan for family trip. The chauffeur and the big black car were a show for work, held reputation of the firm. Mike and Amy did have lots of saving, but they choose to live like that, and thought that would helped their kid grew up more down to earth.

As soon as he parked the car, Carl hurried into the house. He went to the reading room, and there she was, his beautiful wife. Amy was grading papers, she's a lecturer in a university. "Hi, honey." Amy said as she saw Carl at the door. Carl walked straight to the back of her chair, bent down and start kissing her neck. "Not now, Mike. I'm busy. Can't you go do work out or something?" Amy knew what her 'husband' wanted, though she said no, she didn't put a lot of effort on rejecting him. Carl didn't stop, and became handsy, "I'm going to, and I inviting you to join me in some cardio exercise." Then he grab her hand and took her to upstairs bedroom, Amy let him and followed.

* * *


Life couldn't be better for Carl after that, he loved how Mike lived. Mike's not uptight like Jacob, other than jog every morning and went to gym once a week, and went to Church every Sunday as Amy wanted, Mike didn't have much routines he stick with. He worked hard in the past, but now he's in charge, he wouldn't have to be workaholic anymore. Sure sometime the family argued over some little things, sometime work has crisis, but nothing can't be solved. Carl didn't really understood why Jacob would gave up Mike's life just because of guilt.

As for Jacob, he's enjoyed being the son too. Adam was a good kid, grades not bad, about same height with his father but strong enough that wouldn't get bullied, has some friends to hang out. His school life was way better than Jacob had. And at home, at first it's strange that the woman who was his wife few days ago was now his mother, and he had to call a man ‘Dad’ when he knew his not his father, but he get used to it pretty quick. Jacob's family was rich, he have brothers to grow up with, but he never knew what family felt like. His parent always absent, he was sent to boarding school in young age, and now they estranged, only met on special day, not even birthday.

Also Adam was a single child, he got full love and attention from both parent, which sometime make him a bit spoiled and do stupid things, but Mike and Amy still raised him a lot better than most brats, so nothing terrible like drugs or alcohol, yet. Well, he started get invited to party ever since he joined the soccer team, the parent just have to keep an eye out. But now Jacob was Adam, Carl trusted Jacob should have better judgment for those things. "It's hard to say, to be honest." But Jacob told Carl the other way during one of their father and son's gaming time when Carl brought up the 'don't do drugs' subject, while Amy's at reading room.

"I know I should be more responsible, but maybe affected by the under developing brain of a teenager," Jacob said while crushing his old man in a fighting game, "Sometime I do things by impulse lately. Remember what happened to Sam and I few days ago? I knew I shouldn't do that, but I let Sam talked me into it." Sam is one of Adam's friends, a bit of troublemaker. "Yes I'm aware of drugs are bad, you- Mike had shown many cases he had that drugs related to Adam before as example. But, if my- Adam's friends encourage me, I can't promised I won't just go with it under pressure."

"Yeah, you better think of those cases when facing drugs. By the way," Carl asked, "What's in you mind lately?" It's not Carl asking Jacob, But more sounded like Mike trying to find out if there anything troubled his son. "Nothing." Jacob didn't noticed he's back to teenager's behavior. "Really? Nothing like girl problem?" "Mom put you into this, right?" Jacob rolled his eyes, somehow the conversation back to be a real father and son conversation. After almost a month, they were more and more like Mike and Adam, even when no one's around.

* * *


The reason they stayed that long, was because of what Sam and Jacob did few days after the transformation, which make Jacob grounded for a week. They made a plan, they have chose two senior students that Adam didn't acquainted but heard of, so Jacob can't just invited them over. And it's hard to make the transformation in school that has people everywhere, so they figured a party would be easier. But since Jacob got himself grounded, they have to wait another week. And there wasn't always has party around the corner, so weeks turned to almost a month now.

What it's like to live as someone else every minutes for a month? Carl knew the consequences by now. He's tired of reminded himself who he really is, and the frequency is less and less now. Even though he saw Jacob everyday, but sometime he didn't recognized him as Jacob, and they were more and more like how Mike and his son interacted. Now he understood what Jacob said after a week being Mike before, he's either with his family or with his workers, there's only one place that make his Carl's part active, was his work. As a former criminal, now identity snatcher, Carl's past life can be helpful to Mike's work, whether to figure out the client guilty or not, or were they lying to him, Carl can saw through their tricks better than Mike, but the legal stuff still needed Mike's wisdom.

Deep down, maybe Carl won't mind to become Mike at all. One can argued that he has family burden, didn't have freedom like Jacob's single life, can't just go wherever he wanted, but the life is more settled. He won't have to meet girl and see if they matched, then get married and have kid. Now he has skipped all the trouble, with a wife that already love him, a kid that no need to change diaper anymore, will sent away to college after few years but now still has some time to spend together. Then left him and Amy grew old together, have grandchildren visited them later. Carl didn't expected that's what he wanted after all.

As for real Adam, Carl saw him on the work almost everyday too, since Mike and Jacob were good friends. He acted exactly like old Jacob, maybe mentioned something like he didn't know why he would bought some very different style clothes before, and thought that was his middle age crisis. Sometime Mike's part kinda annoyed too, it kept make Carl wanted to save his child from all this, it's very confusing. As Mike, he shouldn't knew this Jacob was the real Adam, but with the combination of Carl's memory, he knew. And since he knew the truth from Carl's memory, then he shouldn't be so protective to his son, no, other guy's son. But after almost a month, he's less aware of this fact too. Maybe that's a sign too, telling him that he should make the next transformation sooner or he might forgot more things.

But something happened might messed up their plan.

* * *


It's the last Wednesday in March, there's a party in this Friday, and Adam was invited, their targets too. Carl and Jacob have discussed the details, now they just have to wait until Friday came. Carl came to firm as usual in the morning, chit-chatting around, then went into Mike's office to start his work. But there's a guest already in there, it's Alice, the alien partner.

"Good morning, Mr. Edwards." Alice didn't put on a smile like usual. "Strange, it feels longer since I heard this name. Like years." Carl's in good mood, he didn't noticed how serious Alice's face was. "Do you have a minute? I'm sorry I came with bad news." She said, now Carl noticed something must be wrong. "Yeah, sure." he then locked the door and put on the soundproof device to make sure no one heard them. Luckily he carried all those devices around everyday.

"I'm sorry to inform you," Alice said as Carl sat on his chair, "that Mr. Stewart was dead. To be exact, he died as you, Carl Edwards was dead."

Carl's brain went blank for a while, then confused, then finally realized how shocked the news was. Part of him felt weird to hear his own dead, whether is Carl's or Mike's. He never planned to go back to his old life, but to shut off the option completely still surprised him. He have so many questions.

And he had to think of how to break the news to Jacob, how Jacob would react can be a crucial point too, with the guilt he already had, now added this, he might chose to back away from all this no matter what, then Carl will lose his ally. It's not like Carl can hide the news from Jacob, the longer he hide, the more chance Jacob would walked away when he found out eventually. But maybe, there's a chance how Jacob dealt with this situation would surprised him.

1232111111111111111111.content:
Of course, "How is this happened?" was the first question Carl asked. Alice took out the surveillance tablet, "I'll show you, it happened in your apartment." She operated the tablet and played the archived video.

It was 2 am last night, Mike, who lived as Carl, came in drunk. He passed out in the living room, didn't locked the door. Several minutes later, a guy came in, he took out a syringe and injected something in Mike's arm, then more syringes, then make the scene looked like Mike took them by himself. "The neighbor saw the door opened and looked inside curiously and found him like that just this morning," Alice said, "The police and ambulance came, it was already too late." She changed the video to live streaming, the body was gone, there's yellow tape around the door, two cops going through the apartment.

"Wait a minute," Carl realized something, "Did you and your guys just watch the whole things and do nothing at that time?" "We can't intervened among humans no matter what they did, and Mr. Stewart wasn't under our protection even though he's involved in this 'research'. Besides, we couldn't have known that guy's intention, it happened so fast, it's not like we can stopped the time and get there in a blink of eyes to stop that. We are not that resourceful. And even Mike didn't died in a short time after that, we can't go heal him, it's considered as intervention too."

Carl lied down on the couch, everything changed so suddenly and he couldn't do anything about it. He took out the phone, decided to text this news to Jacob, let him took some time to absorb, then he can calmed down a bit when they talked about it tonight. For Carl, the news was just shocking, but for Jacob, it's devastating. Carl put some thought on writing that text, then hit 'send'. He surprised that he received a response very quickly. At first Jacob thought he was joking around and not funny, but after Carl sent some screenshots from the surveillance video, when the coroners bagging Mike's body and polices walking around the apartment, Jacob didn't responded back again.

* * *


As soon as Carl straightly back to home from work, Jacob pulled him to Adam's room, and told mom 'he got homework that needs dad's help, hope she won't interrupt until dinner'. He locked the door as they were in, Carl opened the soundproof device, and called Alice to show up. "Tell me everything." Jacob said. Can you use your any alien device that has face recognition or something to identify that guy?" He then asked Alice. "Sorry, some other aliens might have, but we are not focus on collecting human's ID." Alice said.

"...And the police didn't even suspect there's foul play?" Jacob asked. "According to the detectives conversation earlier, they set their mind on closing the case as overdose accident. To be honest, I doubt they can find anything suspicious, the killer looked like a pro, and they don't have the surveillance video like we do." Alice answered, then Carl added, "Even there's some questions like 'how Carl Edwards can afford to get so much drugs', or 'why this guy using needle for drug when he's so drunk', but if the cops didn't put interest in the first place, those questions won't even be asked." Mike's lawyer experience kicked in.

"Then we can..." Before Jacob finished his sentence, Carl knew what he's thinking and stopped him, "No, we can't show them this video, how are we gonna explained where it came from?" Jacob silenced and lowered his head, he had unintentionally avoided to make eye contact with Carl the whole time, who looked exactly like Mike. It's all my fault! was filled in Jacob's mind, If Carl and I make the next transformation earlier, Mike will be very alive in his own life... but then somebody else would still died in his place... I shouldn't agreed to involve to begin with. I should've insisted on against Carl's manipulation. I saw right through his plan at the beginning, but I let my desire beats me.

As Jacob dwelling in sorrow, Carl also thinking of what his next move should be. How should he persuaded his partner if he really wanting to back out. Offer him something to take off his mind? Blackmailed him again? What can he used to threaten him? Before he preparing more comebacks, Jacob broke the silence first, "I want to find that killer. I owed Mike this at the least." "Find the killer? Then what? Make him confessed to the cop? Or kill him?" Carl surprised of what Jacob suggested. "I don't know yet. I will know when I facing him." Jacob said. "Then how do you investigate? As Adam, you can't go anywhere anytime by yourself, and who will gave a teenager any leads seriously?" Carl asked, but he has a bad feeling about the answer he would heard.

"Yes, as Adam, I can't do much. But as a detective, I can." Jacob pointed to the screen of the surveillance tablet, that showing the live feed. Carl saw that there were two guys just walked into the apartment, a uniform police, and an old guy in suits. "Hey, it's one of the detectives this morning." Alice said. "So... you want me to help you to switch with a detective, and investigating yourself?" Carl saw that his bad feeling became real. "Yes. And after everything sorted out, I promise I will help you do whatever you want. Forever. Until you got sick of me." Jacob put out a big promise.

Jacob surprised, he thought criminal like Carl won't actually help anyone, "...Thank you, I guess. So how are we gonna do?" "That's your plan, and you're asking me? Luckily, we already have two candidates there." Carl referred to the guys currently at the crime scene. "How? Alice already said she can't helped us kidnap others before. And even if we drove there by car right now, they would've gone before we arrive." Jacob confused.

"Ah, I think I found a solution. It's quite simple actually, " Carl grinned, "She can't kidnap those guys to us, but, since she can transfer us to anywhere, I bet she can send us to them. What say you, Alice?" he looked at Alice.

Will Alice helped them to get there quickly? Or something else happened?

But what excited Carl most, was his identity. From criminal to law enforcer, from being chased to chasing bad people, it a huge different side and moral, he waited to see which mind in his head will win.

"Fuck, we don't know each other." Carl said as he put on the jacket. Jacob already ready, Jim dressed like a detective in noir film, except he didn't had ruggedly handsome look, "No wonder I can't recall your first name, only last name from your name tag." he responded. They thought the detective and the cop were knew each other since they showed up together, thought that would make them less suspicious if they met up often. "Still, I think it's okay for us to meet at station, it's not rare to see a detective talking to a cop. I'm Detective Jim Rogers, by the way." Jacob introduced himself. "Officer Frank Esposito. Maybe we should exchange phone numbers too." They continued making small talk while took out their phones.

After Carl planted memories, Alice didn't just stand there and do nothing. Since they don't have time, they decided to sent the three naked guys to where their new lives now with clothes at side. Alice transferred them one by one. They might felt weird and can't think of any reason why they woke up in their places naked, like Frank who lived as Jacob Harlan from now on, he wouldn't figured out how he's in his reading room naked, but he would get past that eventually. Adam back to his life, and Jim became Mike Stewart.

One last look of Mike, though not exactly the real Mike, and naked, but that determined his mind what he's about to do wasn't crazy or worthless. Carl also looked at Mike for a while, though he's not sure what was he feeling. Mike's life was good, maybe he will 'revisit' him after things settled. They packed up all the devices, took turn to check on their looks in front of the only mirror in the room one last time. They made the whole transformation in about 20 minutes, still considered a long time just to look for a pen.

They walked out of the apartment quickly, Frank's partner was seemed impatient already, but she tried to sound calmed, "Found your pen, sir?" "No," Jacob said, "thanks for helping anyway, young man. Frank, right?" his acting was very convincing. "Yes, detective." Carl said, while laughing in his head. It's kinda funny now that their ranks were switched, before that, Carl was the one in charge. "I guess I'll see you around, Frank. Officer Banks. Goodbye." Jacob walked to Jim's car, a department issued Civic, get in and drove off, started his life as Detective Jim Rogers.

Officer Valerie Banks waited Jacob drove off, then she started to complain to her partner, "'Frank'? What, you guys buddy now?" "Well, he's a detective, it's no harm to show him some respect." Apparently Jim's incompetence spread far and wide. "Maybe he's not that bad once you know him. I'm sure he once was a good detective too." She tried to think if she noticed the detective has carried a bag before. "Speaking of the test, do you think I'm too soon to take it?" Carl quickly diverted the subject.

After that, it's time to go home, Frank sometime bicycling, sometime took the rail, today he came to station by bicycle. Carl can adapted Frank's life easily with his memory, but he still started to miss everything he had in life before, he even missed the suits. At least Frank wasn't poor, he has a roof on top, food to eat, though the job wasn't that great.

From what he can recalled, Frank Esposito grew up in a bad neighborhood like him too, gangsters everywhere, waiting for him to be old enough to join and die for them. But he chose other path. He finished his high school then recruited into police academy. The path he thought he can help make the world better, start from neighborhood. Carl wondered why his first three transformation were all good guys, making it hard for him to stick to his thieves honor.

As Carl finishing the pizza while watching TV, his phone rang. It's Jacob. "Yeah?" "It's me. How's the night?" It's an old man hoarse voice, since Jacob was in Jim Rogers' body. "Being cop was weird, but uniform's not bad. You?" Carl said. "Pains everywhere, can't stop smoking, and never love beer this much." Jacob coughed a bit, "Let's cut to the chase. I need to ask you one last time: You really didn't know the killer before?" "Wow, sounded like a real detective. Start working on the case already?" Carl teased. "Yeah, and you have different accent. I want an honest answer now." Jacob didn't want to waste time. "Alright, alright. No, I never met that guy before, I swear." Carl didn't have to lie about it, he really didn't know who that guy is, "Maybe he's hired by someone I know, but I don't think I'm important enough or I have enemies that hate me enough to put money on my head."

Jacob silenced a while, "Well then, I believe you, for now." maybe it usual for Jim as a detective to be skeptical, but it's strange to hear Jacob being straightforward blunt, "Now, I want you to take your surveillance device and trace back Mike's every steps last couple days, even weeks. Call me ASAP if you found anything." "Sir! Yes, sir!" Carl said it sarcastically. "...Sorry if I sounded bossy, bad habit of Jim." Jacob knew he's becoming more irritating. "You're lucky Frank is not short-tempered." Carl also sympathized that Jacob just lost his friend, "Anyway, I'll need some time to look through. Though I doubt that will be useful, the surveillance only on my apartment. And what are you going to do?" "I will open the case, have coroner to do the autopsy, gather any information I can. I want solid evidence to charge the killer, so everything by the book. And not gonna let Jim's laziness bested me in anyway."

"Sounds a lot of work." Carl sighed, but part of him was excited actually, Frank's part mostly, he's excited that he can teamed up with a detective, working on a real case, could learned a lot from that. After month of experience, Carl knew by now that strong emotion is something he can't resisted and very vulnerable to get influenced, part of the reason why he can't stayed as himself in most of the time, because he's not felt as strong about lawyer or investigate stuff as the persons he transformed to, which would took over his emotion and even personality. In other word, he's kinda a pushover actually, even though he claimed to be in charge of all this. That's also why he's always been a small thug before, never been able to do bigger crime.

They chat for a while, getting to know each other new identity, "Did you- Detective Rogers really like what they said in rumors?" Carl asked. "I know what they said behind my back. A divorcee with dead-end job, who wouldn't be grumpy?" Jacob exclaimed, "Also maybe he had seen too much tragic, he's tired to be frustrated all the time, then starting to put less and less effort. But everything will be a little different tomorrow. What about Frank?" "Not much, two-years rookie, young and still has hope for the world." Carl felt he left something out, but another call came in, "Sorry, Jacob. I have to take another call, see you tomorrow?" "Okay." Jacob hung up.

Carl knew who's on the other line, "Hey, Ma." It's Frank's mother, she called him every night except when he's on night shift. "Mio figlio! How's the work today? Everything's fine?" "Yes, Ma. Everything's fine." Then she went on asking the usual concerned question, and told him the little thing she faced today. It's been like that ever since Frank moved out, maybe that's why Carl and Frank grew up differently, Frank has a family who love him, while Carl... well, he won't even want to start thinking about them.

Carl won't mind talking with Frank's mother, in fact, he enjoyed to have a concerned mother he never had before. When their conversation ended, it's almost midnight. He fell onto the bed, and quickly asleep. It's been a long day, for Carl and for Frank.

* * *


Thursday morning, Carl woke up before alarm, like Frank always did. First thing he noticed was the 'tent' he built under the sheet, what an energized young body. He grabbed a sock from the floor, with a little fantasy, he released his 'tension'. After that, he started Frank's workout routine, weighing dumbbells, push-up, and sort. During workout, he thought of another thing he just noticed: Frank was gay. He fantasized some male body in his masturbation just now, some were Frank's ex.

And to think about it, there were signs, like when looking at new Mike he was also admiring the naked body; partnering up with Valerie the whole night, he didn't even thought of one obscene fantasy about her sexiness that she tried to hide while on the job; last, talked with his mother for a long time. Frank didn't intended to hide his sexuality, but it's not like he should told everyone he met the first time either. His boss and some of his partners knew, Frank only told them because he knew they were no blabber mouth.

Carl didn't seemed to be surprised by this, which surprised him the most. He wasn't homophobia, but he shouldn't be that acceptable too. Maybe the Frank's memory helped, he's been gay for few years. He's more surprised that Frank's look didn't strike him as gay, or whatever stereotype he think how gay people looked like. But more importantly, was Carl also gay now? The part he loved women and the part Frank loved men, both considered strong emotion, he didn't think he's more sided with either one. So was he bi now?

Carl took a shower after workout while his mind still confused with those questions, he gave up since he won't knew the answer unless he's put into action. And now wasn't the time, he has to go to work. After shower and put on uniform, he cooked some simple breakfast to eat, while watching the surveillance video of Mike. Make use of his time before today's shift. He started from the day before the incident, watched it in reverse order.

* * *


"Hey Frankie, I need to talk to you for a minute." Carl was pulled aside by Jacob after his morning briefing. Valerie was still his partner today, she heard Jacob, nodded to Frank and walked away, "Meet you at the car park later, partner." "You look different... cleaner?" Carl said to Jacob, saw him still wore the same brown coat, different suit, shaved, tie still a little loose. "A little tidiness on appearance wouldn't hurt. This guy is a mess, last night I spent lots of time trying to clean the house, gave up eventually." Jacob then asked, "Anyway, what is your assignment today?" "I get car patrol." Carl answered.

"Great. Make a stop at your apartment, get statement from neighbors. And I'm going to look through some files." Jacob said. "Fine, but it seems like I'm doing all the legwork." Carl complained. "Well, you are the rookie, Frankie. And I'm an old man." Jacob self-deprecating. "By the way, what's with the 'Frankie'?" Frank didn't like to be called like that, thought that sounded boyish. "I don't know, it just came out. Sound friendlier, and you are young enough to be my son." Jacob said. "Well just stop." "Okay, okay. Geez, young man nowadays, not respect to elder..." Jacob stopped as he realized what's he mumbling about.

* * *


"Ready to work, Frankie?" Valerie said and laughed when Carl joined her. "I knew you won't let that go." Carl sighed. "What's the matter, little Frankie? Am I upsetting you? Are you want your mommy?" Valerie continued. "No." Carl said, "And I don't mind being called Frankie." "Really? Then I decided to call you Frankie from now on." Valerie teased. "Fine by me. At least one of us has to be grown up." "If you say so, Frankie. And I might slip out to other partner." "...Alright, what's it gonna take for you to stop?" Carl surrendered.

Valerie seemed to enjoy too much over this little joke, "I'll stop if you tell me what Detective Rogers want from you. Or are you into that type?" Valerie was one of the few people who knew Frank's gay. "No, he just want some legwork from me. Searching his pen last night seems to let him rethink about the overdose case, he wants to investigate a bit." They thought of a reason just now when he and Jacob talked. "Whoa, are you saying we can help out a possible homicide case?" Valerie sounded excited. "We?" "Of course, that's what a partner for." Valerie said, "Beside, you're not the only one to think about become detective someday."

Carl knew he can't argued with her, and also, she's the one driving.
