1232111111111111111111111.content:
Carl visited his old neighborhood one more time, with mix feelings. Last night they came and went in a hurry, now he has time to think how funny and weird and confusing of this were, a low life criminal came back as one of the good cop. He no longer have to dodge or hide from his landlord and people he owed money to, now he can swaggered around as man in blue. If he wanted, he can went and arrested people he hated because he knew what crimes they had committed, read them the Miranda rights, not the one receiving it. Maybe after things settled.

But being a cop wasn't popular. "Excuse me, ma'am. Can I ask you some questions regarding the guy in 3C?" Carl has spoke similar sentence to several residents already, they have to knock on every door, endured every rudeness, and received very least or no help. Most people won't want to snitch, that just asking for trouble. Carl used to love being one of them, now he didn't like it so much. Karma. And also, the killer came and fled the scene late at night, most of them really slept in and didn't saw anything. Carl and Valerie split up to speed up the progress.

"Oh? Is it the dead man yesterday?" An old woman answered the door this time. "I thought they said he killed himself?" "Maybe, ma'am, but we want to eliminate any other possibility." Carl answered, "Do you see or hear anything unusual or suspicious?" "I don't think so, we are at different floor. Although..." she paused and tried to recall, "I did saw a stranger last night." "Can you tell me more, please?" Finally, a witness, and she willing to talk. Carl surprised himself that he's happy about it.

"Well, come on in, I'll get you some tea while we continue, young man. You can call me Mrs. Hernandez, Officer..." She invited Carl. "Esposito." Carl accepted her offer, stepped in her apartment. It's as small as his apartment, but she kept it tidied. Carl sat on a sofa comfortably, she handed him a cup of tea and some cookies. Carl passed her by a couple of time in the hall before, but she wouldn't be that nice to real Carl, though the real Carl was to blame because of his attitude.

Mrs. Hernandez continued her statement, "I saw him at late night, which is unusual even for this neighborhood. I woke up in the middle of the night, couldn't sleep well, so I stand near the window and look at the sky. Then I heard the slam of the door of the hall down here, and a stranger walked out." "Can you described him?" "I can't. It's dark outside, he's wearing a dark coat, and my eyesight isn't good anymore. Sorry I can't be more helpful." She said. "That's okay, ma'am. You helped a lot." Carl came up a plan after he heard her statement.

Even though Mrs. Hernandez didn't saw the killer's face, but Carl can changed her statement a little and put in the description of the killer that he saw in the surveillance. That way he can search the killer from police system and put out a BOLO properly. Luckily Valerie wasn't with him. "Anyway, I should get going. Thanks for the tea and cookies, ma'am. Good day." Carl said and walked out quickly before Mrs. Hernandez wanted to talk some more. He went and found Valerie, told her the altered statement, but she jealous on something else, "Cookies? I got door slamming and dirty flirting. You got cookies?!"

* * *


They still have their assignment to do, so that's it for the case today. No big case along the car patrol, some domestic disputes, neighborhood complains, and public disturbances. By the time they reported back to the station, Jacob has left. Carl suggested he went to his house and reported to him, Valerie agreed. Carl didn't know where Jacob lives now, but he can called and asked him.

After work, Carl bought dinner on the way back to Frank's place. He finished the dinner quickly, then took out the phone and called Jacob, "Hey, Detect- uh, Jake. Are you at home?" "Yes. Call me Detective or Jim, I don't mind. In fact, how about we just called each other who we are now? Save the time to make correction." Jacob answered, "Anyway, why'd you asked?" "I want to meet you and discuss the case, Detective. Hard to do it through phone." Carl emphasized the name part to tease Jacob, thought he must be began to feel self-satisfied hearing people called him detective. "Okay, but do you know where I live?" But Jacob didn't seemed to notice he's been teased.

Just as Carl wanted to ask Jacob his address, a bright light appeared in front of him. Alice the alien showed up. Carl quickly thought of what she can do, "Don't worry, my ride's here. See you in a second." "Wha-?" Carl hanged up the phone before Jacob figured out what he meant. "Hello, Mr. Edwards." Alice greeted as usual, "We heard you guys want to discuss about Mr. Stewart's case, so I'm here to help."

"Oh?" Carl knew the aliens were watch over them all the time, no surprised in there, but this is the first time the aliens offered their help before asked. Maybe it's just because a death man involved, Carl tried not to overthink it, "Okay. First, let us meet Jake at his current location, his new home. I guess you can transport us?" "Sure, piece of cake." Alice then put her hand on Carl's shoulder, and bright light glowed.

* * *


Detective Jim Rogers live in a normal house in town, at least it looked normal on the outside. Inside, like Jake said before, was a big mess. After his divorce, he didn't bothered to clean up anymore. Carl and Alice arrived in the living room, there's magazines, newspapers, clothes, beer bottles and trashes everywhere. No to mention the smell. The only clean place was the kitchen table, apparently Jacob prepared it for case files. No sight of Jacob.

As Carl and Alice looking around the house, they heard the water flushed from toilet, then saw Jacob coming out. "Whew... Hi, Frank, Alice." Jacob was only wearing wife-beater and boxer, he didn't seemed to bother to put on some clothes, "Want a beer?" He took out two bottles of beer from fridge, handed one to Carl and one for himself, then picked up the cigarettes from table and lighted one. Smoking, drinking beer, and wearing only underclothes in front of people, the old Jacob would never done any of these.

"You really let yourself go, huh?" Carl said. "What? You mean the beer and cigarette? It's not as bad as I thought, but I did try to cut down the smoke." Jacob said while leaning on a chair. "What about clothes? Alice's here too, you know." Carl said. "We've known each other, besides, she's not really a woman." Jacob paused and burped, "Don't be so uptight." Me?! Now I'm the uptight one? Carl couldn't believed what he heard. Was it because Jim's older than him, have more memories, so Jacob became easier to be influenced? If so, was it happened to Carl too when he's Jacob or Mike? Is that why he's becoming uptight?

Carl sighed, "Let's talk about the case." "Case, yes. I open the case as investigation on progress, possible homicide. Other detectives think it's odd for me to take the initiative, but the case seems minor so they leave me alone. I asked for autopsy too, but the result comes tomorrow, though I doubt that would be helpful, it's not CSI." Jacob continued, "I pulled out Carl Edward's police record, nothing seemed important recently. And I also talked to Trask. You know him, right?" "Yeah, the detective that keep bugging me in old time, arrested me a couple times. He still alive?" Carl did saw some familiar faces in station these last two days, but no Detective Nick Trask.

"Healthier than me, I would say." Jacob has started his second cigarette by now, "Anyway, I asked him if he knows anything happened to Carl Edwards in last few weeks. He knew nothing. But," he paused for drama, "he told me, there's a robbery in a jewelry store at 16th Street two weeks ago. They didn't have enough of evidence to work the case, not even a suspect. These 3 robbers are pro. The only mistake they made was one of them dropped his mask when they ran out from the store, he put it back on quickly, there's only one witness. And sadly, the witness didn't saw his whole face, only partial. From the incomplete sketch done by his description, Trask said it does have resemblance of Carl Edwards." Jacob stopped and coughed.

Mike, as Carl Edwards, must be accepted a robbery job. He exposed his face during the robbery, his partners don't want to take any chance, so they eliminated him. The killer was either one of the accomplice or hired by them. It's not odd that Mike worked with new people, Carl did that too before. Just unfortunately Mike's new friends were homicidal. The cause and effect became clearer to them, but not very helpful to catch the perpetrators.

"My turn," Carl said, "I found a witness saw the killer leave. But she didn't saw his face." "So you got nothing too." Jacob looked disappointed. "Not exactly. If you agreed, we change her statement to 'saw and gave us a clear description', then we can put the killer face in it." Carl shared his plan.

"Of course, we saw his face through the surveillance already... We don't have much right now, let's give it a try." Jacob said, "Anything else?" "No." Carl sighed, "Why can't be more like TV show? Solved a case in an hour." "Yeah, right." Then they noticed something. Alice was here the whole time and didn't make a sound, but right now she's raising her hand, like a student waiting to be called by teacher.

"Yes, Alice?" Jacob asked. Alice put down her hand, cleared her throat, and said...
1232111111111111111111111.title: Start Investigation

12321111111111111111111111.content:
"Actually," Alice said, "We've found where the killer is." Just a few seconds ago they thought the finding process will took days, never expected this quick. "What the fuck?" Carl yelled, "And you let us wasted all the time to talk about it? How? Where? Tell us!"

"Long story short, we used our techs to trace his steps, and keeping track on him since then." Alice showed surveillance photos while explaining, and a brief personal info of the killer, "He's now at a motel room, too bad we can't just get him over here." "Then teleport us to him now!" Carl suggested the obvious answer.

"Wait!" Jake suddenly shouted. Carl surprised, "Wait for what? Aren't you the one that eager to find the killer?" "I am, of course I am. " Jake tried so hard to sound calm, "But what are we gonna do to him once we confronted him? Kill him? Remember what Alice said, it's against your contract." "Yes, I won't teleport you to him if you're planning to kill other human." Alice confirmed.

"Believe me, I'm not a killer." Carl shrugged, "Then what's your plan? Arrest and interrogate him?" "Right now we don't have any evidence to arrest him." Jake said, "Even we make him talk by tortured him or something, the case won't stand in court. He will be free in no time."

Carl shot another idea, "How about I use my power? You or me become him for a while and confess everything, after jail time guaranteed, we switch back." "That's not a bad plan, but he still could live good in his jail time." Jake said, with Jim's face added more stern, "I want him to suffer the most."

"You gave me an idea," Jake continued, "Give me a day or two to prepare."

"Oh, you guys don't have a day or two," Alice said, "The killer is about to leave the country, he got his fake passport today and has booked a flight early morning with it." She added, "Do you guys ever read the contract we signed? I can't help you once he's outside US."

"Why?" Carl asked, he thought they could just teleport to anywhere. "We have restrictions law, can't go anywhere we want too." Alice answered, "Basically its similar to how human divided the land by nation, we need something like passport to go over the area we assigned too, but it's a lot harder to get those permission. By the way, I have to remind you that you can't leave the country too under the contract." She said the last part to Carl only.

After heard Alice explained her difficulty, Jake then said, "Well then, it maybe rush and risky, but I think my plan still can be done by tonight. Here's my plan..."

* * *


Donald Murphy, the killer, was sleeping when Carl, Jake and Alice teleported to his room. Alice spread the soundproof devices around the room, while Jake cuffed Donald's hand on his back before he noticed and woke up, "What the... who are you guys!" He sit up, quickly aware it's a waste of time to try to escape, a buffed guy and a beautiful girl blocking the way to the door, an old man stood between his bed and the window.

"Are you Donald Murphy?" The old man (Jake) asked. Donald was shocked to hear his real name that he hasn't use in a long time. From his view, that guy was just like any other old man, even smell like one, but has the look of... of course, cop. "Who wants to know? Detective..." "...Rogers." "Detective Rogers, may I know what's this all about? And do you have any warrant?" Donald answered his question with questions, while thinking of how to escape. Once he knew they're cops, he thought the situation would be easier to handle.

Jake didn't answered him either, he moved to next question, "Where were you two nights ago, around 2am?" Ah, so it's about that guy, whatever his name was, Donald thought. He's quite surprised that the cops can track him down that quick, is he leave some evidence in there? Or someone snitched? "Sleeping of course, it's quite tired after a long day."

"You are here for business or vacation?" Jake asked, he still sounded calm, but there's rage in his eyes. "Road trip, you know, seeking warmer place. Just passing here by. May I know why I'm being cuffed now?" Donald played innocence. "Oh? Then why did you booked a flight in the morning?" the buffed guy (Carl) asked this time. Donald saw him working on some sort of tablet since he's here, now he had put down that device. The girl still quiet the whole time.

"Oh, that? I received a phone call telling me that my uncle is dead, the trip has to cut short because I have to go to the funeral." A couple of lies in an instant is easy for guys like Donald. "Boy, aren't you have every answers to every questions," Jake said, "How about this?" He took out a passport for Donald's backpack. "Hey, you don't have the rights to search my backpack." They won't found swag with him, but Donald needed the fake passport for tomorrow's flight, "That just my passport, what about it?"

"It's your photo with different name, 'Donald... MacLeary'?" Jake was hard to see the words without glasses. "So? I hate my abusive father, so I changed my name once I grew up," Donald started to feel less fun, "Look, if you won't say what's all this about, I'm gonna shut up until I get my lawyer."

"Alright, let's cut to the chase. I'll give you one last chance to confess," Jake said with more deeper voice, "Did you killed a guy named Carl Edwards two nights ago? An 'associate' you hired to rob a jewelry store?" But Donald kept quiet this time. Jake waited his response, and took the tablet from Carl. He showed Donald the surveillance. Donald never expected that guy's house has such good surveillance camera, there's plenty of clear vision of his face. But he still won't considered to admit anything, "Like I said before, I want my lawyer."

"I've told you, he won't confess," Carl said to Jake, "It's just a waste of time." Jake stared at Donald for a while, eventually he said, "You know, if you confessed, I might change my mind of what we're about to do to you." Is this guy crazy? Donald started to think.

"You see, the man you killed, was my friend. My best friend, my only friend. He's a good guy, he didn't deserved any of this," Jake said, "I'm sure you are very confused: 'A lowlife like him is a good guy?' Well, you'll know the answer soon. Allow us to demostrate."

Carl took out two pills, he handed one near Donald's mouth. "It's a painkiller, for what's gonna happen next. You can either take this or feel the pain, your choice." Donald hesitated, but seeing Carl also took one, he decided to take the risk. "Now, pay attention." Carl said as he touched Donald twice with his finger.

Donald didn't know what to see at first, then he felt it. He felt his bones moving, the handcuffs and his t-shirt tighten. He looked down and he saw his body grew bigger and muscular. He looked at the guy in front of him, and there's more surprises. Though he can't see everything under Carl's jacket, but he's sure Carl's figure became smaller as his jacket became unfitted. And then he saw Carl's face began to grow beard, his hair grew in incredible speed and color changed. His head shrunk and face shifted. Finally, he saw 'Donald Murphy' standing in front of him.

Donald would jumped up from bed if he wasn't cuffed. "Shocking, isn't it?" Carl smirked. "Wha... WHAT THE HELL!" Donald realised his voice sounded different, while Carl's voice sounded more like his old voice. The girl hold a mirror in front of him, and Donald saw his reflection was different too, he became the buffed guy!

"You see, my friend here has special power." Jake started to explain, while Carl... 'feeling' himself, "So weak, yet so hairy." "As you can guessed, he can swap body with anyone." Jake stay focused, and Carl added, "but I can't swap clothes, tattoos and something else, not now anyway." "That's not important. So, can you imagine what's going on now?"

Donald's mind still blanked, even though he had saw plenty of unusual things in his criminal life, he never expected this became such fiction, he can't stayed as calm as usual. Jake continued, "The Carl Edwards you met, was not the real Carl. He's actually my friend Mike swapped with the real Carl," he pointed to Carl, who now has Donald's body. "I'm the real Carl Edwards, please to meet you. Or should I say I'm Donald MacLeary now? Just so you know, your current body is not Mike's. That's another story." "Don't make him confused more, we don't have much time."

"...So, you guys not really look like that? Not really cops?" Donald digested what he can one by one. "Yep, you start catching up real good, under the circumstances." Carl answered. "Are you try to tell me you can killed me and get away easily?" Donald knew his time was up, but still try to buy some time. "No, killing you would be too good for you, not suffer enough." Jake said, "We are going to let you live a long life, but, as different person."

Before Donald expressed his confusion, Jake continued, "I have another friend. He was caught in a gunfight years ago, a splinter shot into his head, caused him brain damage, since then he was incapable to take care himself, he can't think straight, he can't express himself well. With no hope and no other option, his family sent him away to mental hospital till now."

"Now, can you figure out who you gonna live for the rest of your life?" Jake asked rhetorically. "You're crazy!" Donald shouted, and he started to think a way out. Although all this still seemed surreal to him, he knew he had to escape. And 'luckily', he now possessed a buffed body, and apparently was a cop. If he managed to get out now, he can even ran to police station for help.

The handcuff seems easy to broke the chain with this body, stand up and kick the freak through sheet to avoid any physical contact, then push off the girl and run to the door, the old man might have gun but if I fast enough... yeah, this might work. I have to try, anyway. Donald thought.

Was Donald succeed to escape? Or Jake able to execute his plan? Or something else happened?
12321111111111111111111111.title: Meet the Killer

123211111111111111111111111.content:
"I... I will break out from the hospital in no time. And I'm gonna find you!" Donald said, while seeking a good timing to escape.

"Ah, we didn't explain clearly," Carl said, "You see, you get all the physical status the person you swapped with, not just the appearance, it's everything except minds. But to be honest, we only know tattoos don't applied too by now." Carl rolled up Donald's left sleeve and saw a name tattoo, but Frank's body didn't have those tattoo before. "That's because tattoo didn't produced from human body, like hair coloring or make up also can't be swapped. I know, bummer." This is the first time Donald heard the girl spoke.

"Anyway, once we swapped you with my friend, you'll inherit all his traits, including brain damage." Jake continued, "Not brain dead, he has some consciousness from time to time, you can try to explain your situation to anyone as mental patient, see who would believe. Apart from brain damage, he's younger than me, healthier than me, still have a long life waiting for him. A long time to drive you crazy slowly."

"You can say it's a lifetime sentence. Mind you, when comes the time you finally give up and try to commit suicide, make sure you'll succeed, or else, who knows how the hospital will deal with their suicidal patient." Jake added.

"Any more question?" Carl stood up, with both hands clutching his jeans, Donald's figure was way thinner than Frank's. "If not, let's sta--" "What about your friend? Is he gonna took over my life? You want him to become a wanted person for the rest of his life?" Donald not really wanted to know, just tried to let their guard down.

"Well, not that it matters to you, but we have some other plan for him. Anything better than his current situation, right?" Carl answered, "It'll took a long time to explain, as you can see-" Carl was interrupted by Donald. Donald suddenly jumped up, and kicked the sheet over Carl. "What the fuck!" as Carl shouted and fell down, Jake, with Jim's years of police experience he got, reach to the gun in holster.

But Jake wasn't quick enough. Though Donald not able to broke the chain of handcuff, he still strong and fast enough with Frank's body, and the door only guarded by Alice the alien. Donald thought he could took down the girl easily, but he didn't expected she has a small device in her hand, she hold it up and spray some purple mist to his face, Donald avoided at the last second but still inhaled some, enough to put him to sleep in no time. Donald's escape plan failed.

All this happened in seconds, when Carl got out of the sheet and stood up with pants down, Donald was passed out on the floor already. Jake put down the gun, "Told you no need to demonstrate your ability on him, of course he would try to escape." "You're the one that wants him to understand the whole things so that he knew what he confronted, " Carl said.

"Let's just start, shall we?" Jake back to calm. "Alright, alright." Carl said, while pulling up his pants.

* * *


3:20 a.m., St. Heart Hospital. The night shift staff just finished routine room check. In room 201, Tom Hill was slept soundly after his night pills, not even four people suddenly appeared in his room with a blink of light could woke him up.

Jake sprayed the yellow mist to Tom's face to wake him up, while Carl and Alice putting down the naked Donald on the floor. Tom opened his eye and saw them, before he screamed, Jake covered his mouth, "Calm down, Tom. It's me, Jim Rogers, you remember me?" The room was dark, Jake used his phone's flashlight to show his face.

Tom looked, then nodded. "Now, you know you can trust me, right? Be quiet and take this pill, it will help you. Do you understand?" Jake uncovered his mouth, and handed him the painkiller. "J- Jim, yell -yell a lot, my- my friend." Tom said. "That's because you always hotheaded, you think I liked to yell? Just take the pill," Jake put the pill in his hand, Tom paused, then put it in his mouth and swallowed.

"Alright, sit still. And this is my friend, will you shake his hand?" Jake signaled Carl to get closer. Carl reach out his hand, Tom hesitated but also put out his hand. Carl was still in Donald's form when he touched Tom, then he went and touched Donald who in Frank's form. Tom's figure wasn't much different than Donald's, skinny, similar height, messy hair. Tom felt something shifted, he couldn't figured out at first, but as time went by, he discovered he can think straightly, no more noises in his head that scrambled his mind, it's been a long time since his mind was that clear.

And then Tom saw something that he thought he just went crazy to a whole new level. The man that shook his hand, was became bulkier, more muscle, with whole different face. "What the hell?" he heard his voice sounded different, then he thought maybe his voice changed after all these years, "Jim! Who is he? Wait, I can speak normally, and think normally! Is that because of the pill?" He finally can worked his brain like normal, filled with more and more questions.

"I'm glad it all works out too. But let's get out of here first, then I will explain everything. Now, leave all your clothes here, and put this on. Be quiet, be quick." Jake handed him a bathrobe. Jim was not only Tom's partner but also his mentor, so even the order is strange, Tom still obliged to listen to Jake, who he thought was Jim.

During stripping, with only light came from one phone, he has noticed his hands looked unfamiliar. No, not just hands, it's like his entire body was... a stranger to him. Gosh, am I change that much after the injury? How long was I out? He thought. In the mean time, Jake was using the memory device, copied Tom's memory and put it into Donald's head. He didn't gave him all the memory, only the years that Tom became mental.

Carl, with Frank's body, can now pick up Donald by his own and put him on the bed. Donald still asleep, in Tom's body, when he wakes up, he no longer has his sanity. Jake tossed Tom's clothes on Donald, and whispered to him knowing he can't heard him, "I'll visit you from time to time, make sure you live long and suffer. Also, enjoy my friend's memory lane of all these crazy years."

"Everything's set, let's go." Carl ordered as he saw Tom has ready. Alice put a hand on Tom's shoulder, with Carl and Jake formed a circle. Tom glimpsed at the naked guy on the bed and shocked, as he saw 'himself' lying there. Before Tom can expressed how shock he was, with a gleam of light, they were not in the hospital anymore.

* * *


Tom looked around, all seemed familiar, he visited here before. They were transported back to Jim's house. Shock after shock, Tom wasn't sure what shocked him more now, or what he should ask first. "That's it, I must be still in hospital bed. This is a whole new level of my crazyiness, weird realistic dream." Tom spoke to himself.

Alice pinched him on his arm, "I heard that's how to prove dreaming or not." Tom felt the pain. "You're not crazy, not anymore. We'll explain everything to you one by one. First, let me introduce this two to you. She is Alice, He is Frank." Jake said, as he grabbed a few bottles of beer from fridge and gave one to each, "Alice has advanced tech stuff, like transport four persons from place to place in seconds. And Frank is a police."

Jake and Carl decided to change some facts, like let Tom thought who they seemed to be would be easier. "He is also a shapeshifter." Tom choked when he heard what Jake said, such science fiction word coming from his mentor's mouth. "Don't believe? When you done coughing, go to the mirror and see for yourself," Carl pointed the mirror at the hallway.

Tom walked up to the mirror, he saw his face clearly, only that wasn't his face at all. No way the brain damage of all these years could make him that different, unless some doctor gave him plastic surgery. Different hair color, different chin, different nose... he opened his robe, everything looked different too because they were.

And then Tom remembered the guy he saw in his bed, "This is the face of that guy, right? The guy that replaced me at the hospital?" "Woah, you took the news very well, way better than your partner when he saw my ability for the first time," Carl said, "Yes, I have switched you and him, which also answered your question before: No, it's not because the pill, it's because you are using his healthy brain, so you can think straight now. And he has your body, which means he's the mental now."

"Don't worry, he's a scum, a murderer, he deserves this treat more than anyone else," Jake continued. Tom stopped 'admire' his new look and back to the living room and asked, "A killer? Why not just put him on sentence?" "Because we're short on evidence, if he goes to court, chances are he might got away," Jake answered, "So when I know what Frank can do, and he introduced Alice to me, I came up with this plan, that I can save you while bring that guy to justice by our own."

"Let's take a break, how about you go clean yourself up while absorb what you knew so far? There's some clothes in the bathroom for you too." Carl suggested. "Oh? Okay, I guess." Late night in spring, Tom felt the chill with only robe on, he went up to the bathroom on second floor, where Jake told him to.

"Don't you worry he might ran off?" Carl make small talks with Jake while waiting for Tom to continue. "Why would he run? It's not like he has place to go, not with that face," Jake said. "I don't know, panic? Scare? Still think all of this was just his mind trying to screw him? Want to find his family no matter what? Think he's abducted by aliens, and this whole thing is an experiment? Not so farfetched for an assumption," Carl joked.

Will Carl's bad joke became true, or they continued their plan when Tom came down?
123211111111111111111111111.title: Saving Officer Hill

1232111111111111111111111111.content:
Carl and Jake discussed how to reveal the rest of the plan to Tom, while Tom was upstairs. They stayed in their characters while talking, in case Tom can heard them.

Tom was back after 15 minutes, "To be honest, I'm more of a briefs guy." He said, while adjusting his crotch. "That's what bothering you more? Not wearing someone else's underwear, or, I dont' know, someone else's body?" Jake picked on Tom, as what Detective Rogers always do. "Well, if you put it that way... Anyway, I don't think the clothes belong to this body, a bit loose," he's wearing a checkered shirt, a cargo pants and boots, all seemed oversize but a bit shorter to Donald's skinny tall body. "You're right, they're mine. I have a hunch you're gonna need them later. Now, anything you want to ask first?" said Carl.

"How about tell me how you guys meet. How Frank got the power? How Alice invented such tech stuff? I don't think in my absent years the science would improved that much, unless we encountered... aliens? Did we make contact with aliens? Do we have time machine now?..." Tom kept going on and on, until Jake yelled, "For fuck sake, shut up a minute would'ya? Gosh, I'm starting to regret on saving your ass, forgot how annoying you can be."

"But you said I can ask..." Tom complained, with weak voice like kid tried protest the parent. "Anyway," Jake said while rubbing his head, "I see you have taken all this very well, back to yourself in such short time, maybe we should proceed to next phase right now." Jake also wanted to avoid answering those questions, so he took the opportunity to change subject.

"What next phase?" Asked Tom, Jake distracted Tom. "It's about your life," Carl answered, "Your current body is a criminal, which means even we gave you a new identity, you still could be danger if recognized by someone know him. So, we thought you would like a new face to live the rest of your life."

"As we said before, you can't get your old body back," Jake said, "if you have to stay as other person for the rest of your life, might as well not look exactly like a criminal." "You mean I can choose whoever I want?" Tom intrigued. "Not really, it's not like we can go out and 'browsing' people on the street and kidnap whoever you want. My power worked almost instantly, it's risky to be witnessed or caught on camera. I'm still try to keep my power a secret." Carl said.

"Second, we don't know what's the deal with that stranger, what if you happen to choose another criminal? Or the one that has cancer or any weird disease?" Alice pointed out. Actually they can use some alien device to do a quick scan to know for sure, but of course they can't revealed that to Tom.

"From three of us, you can rest assured we are healthy. Well, Rogers here might not counted as healthy because... you know, but at least no any serious disease, yet." Carl said, "and you can get senior discount after few years." Jake grunted, but tired to argue.

"After another transformation, we will provide you a new identity. Lady here can make a transporter, she also can make a perfect fake ID." Alice nodded and added, "Not just ID, I can fake a whole new life, give you a new birth certificate, education background, et cetera, and I can guarantee they will be flawless."

"But, here's one rule you have to follow: you will not be anywhere near here once all done, ever." Carl delivered bad news before Tom got too excited, "and you can't meet your family and friends, and of course said anything here to anyone." Tom frowned, Carl continued, "You have to start your new life in else where, you will be leaving this state at the morning. Think of it like Witness Protection Program."

"My family... how are they?" Everything seemed surreal tonight until this moment, Tom was pulled back to reality, "Last I can remember they visited me in hospital, I don't think I saw my dad." Obviously, Carl and Jake didn't have the answer but Alice did, "From what I found on internet, your parent separated a year after your incident, your sister engaged to her boyfriend half years ago." "Huh, not so surprise, still..." Tom said with a sad frown.

"If it helps, we just don't want you to make contact with them. Nowadays you can follow anyone on the internet, your sister have facebook and twitter, through her you can know your family situation over the time." Alice added, "But keep in mind, never attempt to inform her who you are, I'll know."

"So who do you choose? Your old partner, me, or a whole different gender? Mind you, it's one time deal, no return policy, because we won't meet again." Carl tried to enlighten the moods, "I think it's an obvious choice, isn't it?" He showed his biceps as he said. And without much hesitation, Tom said, "I guess... Sorry, Jim, and uh, Alice." "No surprise, but luckily you won't be duplicating his cockiness." Jake said with poker face. "Eh? Did someone curious about my cock?" Carl childishly response.

Seeing lacks of reaction from others, "Jokes aside," Carl cleared throat and said, "before we do that, there's some risk we need to address. You see, I always use my power to 'swap', haven't use it for 'change'." "What's the difference?" Tom asked. "I'm still study my power, so far, I know I have to make 2-ways change in 1 transformation: One change let myself becoming the target, followed by another one for other to become me." Carl explained.

"What we about to do is 1 and a half time, first two changes for us to exchange body, then a third change for me to change back and stop there." Carl explained, "But we never try to stop in the middle of the process, will I able to touch someone else after that and not change that someone? Will I able to stop it but my power will gone forever? Or maybe everything will be alright? Anything possible."

"And you willing to test it out?" Tom asked, considered they just met in less than 2 hours, "I mean, you might lose your power because of someone you barely know." "Well, eventually I have to find out the answer, why not now? And Rogers vouch for you, that's enough for me." Carl answered, part of him did wanted to know will it work or not, part of him scared of losing his power. But he's feeling helpful, part influenced by Frank's personality.

A moment of silence, until Tom broke it, "Okay, let's do this." "Alright, I'll start making fake ID. Want to go oversea or road trip across states?" Alice hold up a tablet, at least it looked like a tablet for Tom. "I don't have money to travel. Heck, I don't have any money for anything." Tom said. "I'll book a plane ticket anywhere you want to go with a passport, and open a bank account on your new identity, there will be about 5,000 in it for you." Alice said. "Whoa, you can do that?" "It's easier than teleport. I can gave you more, but I think it's better not to alert the bank. It's enough for you to start fresh anywhere as long you didn't gamble it away."

During their conversation, Carl instructed Tom to stand in front of him, he handed him the painkiller, while Jake taking another cigarette. "Here we go." Carl touched Tom twice, then let the change begin. It's the first time for Tom to see and feel the change with clear mind. Carl, or "Frank" in front of him, becoming taller and thinner, make Carl has to grab his pants before it fell, the face of him became the guy Tom saw in the mirror moments ago. And Tom himself felt every inch of his skin moved too, but no pain. He became shorter but muscular, fitting to the clothes and shoes he's wearing.

The transformation finished, while Tom still stunned and amazed by it -- you could say that's the normal reaction of everyone's first transformation experience -- Carl touched Tom again. His body changing back to Frank's form, but Carl was more concerned on the glow on his finger. Didn't know what else can do, he concentrated on thinking "cancel second change", "reset", something like that, hoping it worked like the first time he somehow managed to switch off the glow.

Since there's nothing for Jake to do, he just sat on the couch enjoying his cigarette, watching them busy doing their thing. Tom, being the chatty one, now expressing his thoughts, "I'm never a muscle man, I mean, I'm not easy to get fat thanks to family gene or something, but I never able to grow big muscle, not that I tried before. When I graduated from academy, my physical score was barely passable, but this- this body- wait, is it still narcissism if I admire my body but not really my body? And, do you, I mean, do we have any allergies? Will it be too much work to stay in shape?..."

Tom kept going on and on, didn't paused for people to answer. His voice sounded exactly like Jake's, but a little different accent because unlike Jake, he didn't have Frank's memory. "...short hair, stubble, an intimidating look, with deeper voice. You know, even I made it to detective, they still look down on me because I look green. By 'they' I mean Jim and other detectives..."

Before Jake about to yell 'shut up!' to Tom, Carl shout out "YES! It worked!" first. Jake looked at him, noticed that his finger no longer glow. Carl tried to trigger it again, and this time the glow was different color than last one, which should means it's a new cycle of transformation, "Fuck yeah, that means my power has reset or whatsoever, right? Alice?" Alice still busy on the tablet, replied "How should I know?" without looking at him. "It definitely is, I'm sure of it!" Carl and Tom keep talking excitedly.

"Knock it off, you two! This is why I feel lucky to not have any kid," Jake said. "Sorry," Carl and Tom said simultaneously. "Hey, look at the time, how about we go out for breakfast? I'm starving." Tom suggested, it's just passed 5 o'clock in the morning. "All of us? I don't know, " Carl opposed, "what if someone I know sees us? What should I say? I have a secret evil twin brother?" "I agreed, too risky." Jake said.

Will they went to diner, or something else happened?
1232111111111111111111111111.title: Extreme Makeover

12321111111111111111111111111.content:
7:30a.m., outside a diner far from city. "Gosh, I missed bacon so much," Tom said after a burp. "Yeah, I believe you," Carl said, after seeing Tom stuffed his mouth full with anything he can grab. Both of them were wearing caps, Tom added glasses. "Finally," Jake said while grabbing a cigarette, "'No smoking inside' my ass."

"Guess it's time to say goodbye. I can't thank you enough for all this." Tom looked at Carl, "I promise, I will make your face proud... It sounded less weird in my head." "Just as long as you didn't do something that will put you up for DNA test. Remember, Alice has altered your fingerprints so we won't have the same, but she can't change your DNA, or technically, my DNA." They shook hands, Carl asked, "So you have decided what to do next?"

"Nah, I am more of a going with the flow guy, which is why I became a cop in the first place. Quite an interesting story, actually." Tom said, " Anyway, I don't know if I ever want to be cop again, but for now I want something simple, a stock boy in grocery store, or an accountant in some big corporate. I do have accounting degree now." Tom referred to the fake education background of his new identity.

"You don't actually know a thing about accounting, you know." Jake pointed out. "I had some courses in night school before, didn't I told you before?" Tom said. "You talk all the time, sometime it just a buzzing sound in my ears," Jake teased.

Before this turned to another argument, Carl announced, "Hey, look at the time, you guys should go now." "You sure you and Alice can't come with us to the airport?" Tom asked. "It's okay, give you guys to catch up." Alice said.

"Alright, and hey," Tom said to Carl and Alice, "I know it's precaution, but I do hope we can meet again." "Let's just see what future take us, now you go live your new life, and don't turn out to be a psychopath, that will be enough." Carl said.

* * *


Carl and Alice watching Jake and Tom drove away. Everything's according to plan, a risky plan, which make Carl wondered the whole time: why Alice, the aliens will allowed it. Now that they alone, it's time to find out why.

"Let them go by themselves, won't you worried?" Carl asked. "Worry about what?" Alice said. "They might team up, run away, try to expose us and such." Carl said. "I'm not worry, I believe in Jake. Aren't you?" Alice said. "You know what? How about we go back to my place and continue?" Carl said with a little shiver.

With a blink of eye, they're transported back to Frank's apartment, warm with heater. Today was Frank's day off, but he has a part time job at night, still plenty of time to kill. "Let's start from beginning." Carl sat on the couch and said, "You always said no to interfere human society, keep it secret from others, and borrow me more Alien techs. Why this time so different?"

"Let Tom knew some of our secrets, make him a fake identity, hacked into bank, send him away without brainwashing or something. It's like you intent to break every rule you make. " Carl said. "You sure have detective instinct." Alice teased. "It doesn't need Frank's instinct to see something's wrong. Now, tell me the truth." Carl said.

"It's not that complicated. Remember the ultimate rule? 'No human killed during this cooperation.' Though that has nothing to do with us, but 'your' death still causes us a lot of trouble." Alice explained, "At that time, we don't know whether the killer knows anything about us, so we have to find him."

"Once we knew he knows nothing, our work has done. The rest of the plan is all your decision. We provide help as usual, and this time partly also because Jake promised he will take full responsibility." Alice said. "Wait what? Jake the one that in charge?" Carl surprised.

"I should let Jake answers that." Alice said, "About the rest, faking a new identity isn't much affect to human society, under this circumstance. We lie about hacking into bank, we actually just opened an account and transferred in some of our fund money. And finally, we didn't always use brainwash or wipe memory to hide our existence, we are more civilized than you think."

"But let me do all the dirty works," Carl said. "By your choice. And speaking of that, your support on Jake's plan is more surprising to us." Alice tackled back. "You wanna said I'm under influence of Frank's personality again? we've been over this before." "Yeah, but I think we should make some routine mental check, especially now you can't go back to your life." Alice sound sincere.

"I never want to go back to my life in the first place." Carl pointed out, "And even changing life messed up my mind, so what? Can't I be good?" "If you say so." Seemed like Alice still won't let this subject go, but she didn't push Carl either. "Anyway, if nothing else, how about you beam us to Jim's apartment, we wait Jake over there." Carl said.

* * *


Jake's home when Carl was touring the house, and even helped tiding up a little bit. It's a two-floor house with an attic, no yards, old but not too shabby, and convenience. Jim bought it years ago, when he and his ex-wife just married. After their divorce Jim got the house, but lose everything else. With nothing else to look for, he planned to just die in this house someday, alone or not, if not because Carl and Jake.

"Come in, make yourself home," Jake said with a bit sarcasm. "Tom's on the plane to Toronto safely?" Carl ignored his sarcasm. "I guess." Jake put down his jacket, then sat on Jim's usual couch. After up all night, and still going to work later, Jake too tired to make small talk, so he straightly asked, "You guys must be here for a reason, what is it?"

"Alice told me that you two have some sort of deal." Carl said, he's more curious than angry about being kept in the dark. "Oh... thought I can have some time to ease you in," Jake sat up, in all seriousness, "Carl, this is the end to me."

"I lied, I won't accompany you on your journey, or experiment, anymore. I want to stay here forever, I will be Jim Rogers until I die. This way Tom can contact me whenever without suspicious. This is my choice." Caught him off guard, Carl don't know what to react. He finally asked, "Why?"

For a moment Jake looked sad, but his voice was calm, "Growing up, I, Jacob Harlan was a social awkward boy. I don't have friends, my family always absence. But I told myself that's okay, at least I have a decent life. I have a boring but well-paid job, My saving was enough for the rest of my life and more."

"But I still looking for connection, whether with wife, family, or friend, any kind of relationship. Knowing that I have a place before going places, knowing I'm not alone. Mike gave me one. Yep, that sounds gay. But Mike was the best thing that happened in my life. He's a good man, a good husband, and most important to me, a good friend. A bad influence, yes, but a sincere friend."

"And I betrayed him. I dragged him into this, and he ended up dead. Yes, you're the one that forced me at first, but I would be lying if I said I don't enjoyed a bit. Yes, we can't predicted he would be killed, but if I really don't want to involve him at all, I will find a way no matter what. I let jealousy get the best of me, deep down I envy his life, I want his life."

"Well, you still can, I can transform you back." Carl realized that's a dumb idea before he finished the sentence. "And remind myself that I caused his death every time I look into the mirror? No thanks." Jake said.

"So what? This is some kind of punishment for yourself? Stuck in this miserable old man's life? Just for a friend?" Carl tried different strategy, "What about the real Frank and Jim? Aren't their lives matter too?"

"Well, Jim now lives Mike's life, I don't think he would complain that, we both know Mike was like a model of American Dream. As for Frank, that's up to you, if you don't change him back, sure he's older and alone, but he won't have to worry the danger in the line of duty, and money." Jake continued, "And yes, it's a punishment for myself that I can think of, that's the least I can do. Maybe someday I will regret, maybe not, but for now that's what I choose."

"Enough! If you're not coming with me, I'll go after Mike's family." Carl try different move--threaten, "I don't mind getting my hands dirty if that's what the cost."

"No, you will not." Jake didn't even flinch, "You're not a good guy, I'll give you that, but you're not killer or torturer type of criminal either. We spend months together, I think I know you enough. There's line you wouldn't cross, and it's not because you were affected by other's mind, it's you."

"The proof is whoever you become, you didn't even try to ruin their life. You didn't make my old life worse, you didn't mess up Mike's family, you didn't fool around Frank's job. You are just a selfish man enjoying someone else's life, and you can do that without me." Jake paused, "Beside, Alice won't agree to harm any human, so that's not going to work anyway."

"That's right." Carl turned to Alice, "Alice, are you gonna let him go just like that?" "Jake wasn't the one signed contract with us, and our evaluation said we can trust him to keep secret." Alice answered, "To be honest, we are more agreed on his deal. He promised to be like middle man for us, help tracking Jim's status, visit Donald, and maybe useful later for other things."

Losing only ally, before Carl can think of his next move, Jake provided him some ideas, "Now, you can brainwash me with the device, make me your puppet or whatever, I won't stop you. Maybe that's good for me too, forget all this. But if you consider me as your friend, I hope you can respect my decision."

Carl speechless. He knew he had lost him, and there's nothing he can do about it. Brainwash was never occured to him, Jake was right, they became friend along the way, friend he ever had in a long time. Is it finally came to this?
12321111111111111111111111111.title: Three guys, a girl, and after diner

123211111111111111111111111111.content:
"Take your time to think. If it helps, I'll still helping you whatever I can, just not go with you, so if you need help around here, call me. Now, I'll have to go and prepare for work." Jake said, as he stood up and went upstairs, leaving Carl and Alice in the living room.

Carl couldn't think of anything to help control the situation. He didn't have any card left. "It's all your fault, you know?" He starts blaming Alice. "How so?" Alice asked.

"If you guys can found the killer sooner, Jake and I won't ended up here, and he would still be Adam, but since he can't facing Mike anymore, he would follow me to anywhere else I want."

"Well, it's your decision to follow his plan. Beside, that leads us to Tom, a perfect candidate for punish Donald without killing him. If you think about it, maybe that's what you called fate."

Carl knew that, but that doesn't mean he can't felt mad. With nothing else can be blamed, Carl took out the memory device, considered what Jake had suggested. It tooks Jake only 5 minutes to come back down, with clean worn-out shirt, 'clean' as in 'not smell yet'. Carl watched Jake walking around to get prepared for work, he adapted Detective Jim Rogers's life so well.

Jake pulled out a gun from his shoulder holster, checked it then put it back. "Alright, I'm heading to station now. Want a lift?" Jake said while adjusting his coat.

Jake didn't seemed to think about using the gun to defend himself, Carl can wipe his memory in a second if he want to. Maybe it's time to be aggressive, he's a selfish man like Jake said after all, what so surprise if he did brainwashed him to get what he want?
123211111111111111111111111111.title: Intersection

123211111111111111111111111112.content:
Weeks later, state park.

It's noon of mid spring, the weather is warm, not many people in the park. Detective Jim Rogers sat on a bench, watching people came and went, analyze what might they do for living, one of his occupational habit.

Then he noticed a man approaching. Caucasian, trimmed goatee, grey but thick combed hair suggested he might as old as Jim, a wedding ring on his finger. He has one of those look that can easily scored a good first impression. Average height and body size, wearing a suit like most people here. There's some business buildings near this park, office workers must've been often came here.

Jim never saw this man before, and nothing about him stood out among the crowds, still something catches his eye. The man saw Jim looked at him, gave a smile and walked toward him, then sat right next to him, while there's still has some empty bench.

"It's getting hot for spring, isn't it?" The man opened up a conversation with Jim.
"Said the man with sweater vest," Jim teased, he knew who he was as soon as he talked: the guy who set up this meeting, the guy with thousand faces.

"Well, my workplace always felt colder than outside no matter what season," Carl Edwards, the man, laughed, "Men at our age are getting weaker, don't you say, Jake?"
"Weak? Didn't you have better physical than original?" Jim, used to be Jake Harlan, said.
"Why yes, you remember. I am but I have to play the part, don't I?"
"Who are you this time? Some big shot in big company? Or do you just have some sort of old people fetish?" Jim teased again.

"It's not my fault that most of the powerful men are men." Carl said, "This guy is a bank manager. I thought bank manager can do shady things under radar, turns out not that easy, if I want to make sure very discreet." Carl laying back and crossed his legs, "Long story short, I'm about to ditch this and travel away."

"They allowed you to travel far now?" Jake curious. Carl knew that 'they' referred to the aliens.
"They didn't approve at first, but I convinced them if they want to continue to make progress on the project, eventually I can't stay in one place forever." Carl smiled, "So, this could be your last chance to come with me. Are you bored of Jim's life yet?"

"Is that why you want to meet?" Jake sighed, "The answer is 'no'."
"You sure? I'm will be gone for a long time, don't say I didn't asked you."
"No." Jake still gave a simple answer, with no explanation.

"...Find. Anyway, how's life treating you lately?" Carl changed the subject, "I heard Detective Rogers is very hardworking recently, and cleaned himself up pretty nicely, cutting alcohol and cigarette, it's like he's a new person. And is that new suit? Isn't it a little over detective's paycheck?" Carl pointed Jim's clothes. Jim was wearing a suit too, but unlike old worn-out cheap one that last time Carl saw, this is new and neat, less 'detective vibe'.

"If you want to know, it's two-for-one sale. Still, it's a huge improvement compared to Old Jim. I chose to live this life, doesn't mean I had to stay sloppy. And my new side job needs a better wardrobe." Jake said.
"Side job?" Carl asked.
"Seemed like Alice didn't told you all about me." Jake mocked, "Then maybe I shouldn't either. All I can say is I'm kinda working for Alice sometime now, and it paid pretty well too."
"They PAID you? Look at me, I didn't get a penny since beginning, I have to find money on my own! And failed!" Jake grumbled, "Don't tell me they gave you some alien devices too?" Jake silent, but the question has answered, Carl frustrated.

After a moment, "...Let's just move on." Carl said, "How's the other two?" "Who?" "You know, Tom and... Dan?" "It's Donald." Jake corrected him, "Tom adapted his new body very well, had many sex along the road, if you believe him." "Yeah, you had no idea how good Frank's body is." Carl confirmed it. "Anyway, he currently settled in a small town, don't know will it be permanent, got a new job as security guard." "Wait, I thought he said he never want risky work anymore. What about accountant?" "Guess he can't deny his nature. I won't surprised if eventually he will become the town sheriff or something like that." "Fool always be fool." Carl teased, but deep down he envied the man with dedication.

"As for Donald," Jake continued, "I visit him every weekend. He acted like how Tom used to be, but more confuse, saying more things that don't make sense, other than that nothing suspicious. Kinda feel pity for him, well, when I forgot who he really was." Jake paused, talked about Donald reminded him someone. "He got what he deserved, after all." Carl said, it's something he knew he shouldn't make fun of, at least not in front of Jake.

"My turn. How's Jake and... Mike?" Jake finally asked what's on his mind the whole day. Ever since he became Jim Rogers, he didn't check on his old life once. He could've poke around by himself, but he didn't. "Huh? I thought you would asked Alice to keep you update." "I didn't." "Well, I changed Frank back to himself, but right now the one who live as Jacob Harlan isn't this guy." Carl pointed to himself, "That's another story."

Her face was blank, and the creature hadn't yet had time to process all the information in his host's head--names, places, human norms and social expectations, muscle memory, etc. These things would come, but for now the creature was a little bit like a kid trying to drive for the first time.

The thing left Rose's mouth hanging open because it didn’t know any better; she'd begun to drool a little. Grass and grass stains had soiled Rose’s nice clothes as her possessed form awkwardly walked toward the door. Deep, alien noises escaped her lips and she breathed. 12421222.content:
Across town in the early morning air, an industrial haze coated the warehouse district. The city had been hit by the same industrial decline that had afflicted many other urban cores in the United States; most of the factories were gone, and real estate values in those areas were down considerably. A couple of factories remained, and their smoke stacks reached like the arms of god himself into the sky. Some of that haze made its way back nearer to the ground; this and the silence of the abandoned are made for a particularly eerie feeling.

Two police officers, Brenda Nelson and Nick Trask, rolled through the quiet scene without even the lights on their car flashing. Nick was thinking that a call was a waste of his talents; the man had an MA in criminal justice for fuck sake, and he was stuck in a patrol car in an abandoned end of town instead of making the next big drug bust. Nick was a portly young man of 25 with immense capabilities; these capabilities included eating hot dogs, which explained why his belly jiggled with every trip over the railroad tracks or every encounter with a pot hole. He wore a suit and tie to work every day, but felt himself the big fish in the little pond.
Brenda Nelson was older than Trask. At 45, she’d been around a little bit, seen a few things. The years of tough experiences that had given her street smarts did quite little to diminish her beauty, though. Sure, at 45 a wrinkle appeared here and there on her face, but she had the most beautiful curly blonde hair and a smile that would light up a room. She’d packed on a little bit of weight the last few years—not much, mind you—enough to fill out her body and give her a very curvy frame, complete with a bubbly, round ass, jello-like boobs that swayed and jiggled, and also a slight flab in her belly, just a little pouch that formed mostly because, with her long hours, Brenda couldn’t eat as healthy as she’d have liked.

“What’s the story with this one, Brenda?” Trask asked. “Oh, nothin’ major,” she answered, “report of some weird stuff here, some noises and such…this place should be abandoned. Probably just some kids got stoned around here and blew somethin’ small out of proportion.” The officers came to a stop outside a broken gate, which they opened and walked through. “You go left; I’ll got right, and we’ll meet up in the middle, and radio if you hear anything weird,” Brenda told Trask. “All right,” he answered.


Brenda walked off to the right of the big dark building, walking in the midst of giant steel beams and industrial equipment the owners of the last factory probably thought was not worth moving. Brenda’s husband had left her years ago, and this job was all she had, all that excited her, and boy did she love it. Sure it was a bit weird working around an overwhelmingly male police force all the time, and jokes about the size of her tits knew no end. She could put up with that, though, and at least it wasn’t as bad now as it had been years ago, when she was 25 instead of 45. Some of it was perhaps an honor, really. She certainly didn’t want her looks and beautiful figure to overshadow her work, and any joke could wear out its welcome if told enough times, but for the young guys who were just fresh from the academy and new to the force, it turned Brenda on a little that they still thought she was beautiful. There was a measure of pride in being the cougar of the police force.

She walked through the darkened warehouse, hearing the echo of her every step and not a great deal else. Then, she heard a metallic clanging sound, and her muscles tensed up; she instinctively put her hand on her gun. “Who’s there?” she tensely called out. No answer. “Trask is that you? Stop fucking around!” Again, no response. Brenda walked a few steps farther through the dark building. Suddenly, out of nowhere comes a monstrous creature. It jumps at the unsuspecting Brenda Nelson; it walks on two legs and has a facial and body configuration like those of humans, but there the similarities stopped. This creature was covered in moist, gooey green scales, and it had a long lizard-like tongue. It had some electronic devices implanted around its eyes that emitted a blinking red light, and a bracelet on its slimy wrist was some type of computer device. The creature lunged at the officer, and, just as Brenda tensed up and drew breath to yell for Trask, the thing opened its mouth wide and spat a sort of green vapor into her face. Suddenly, the woman’s mind went blank; her body was paralyzed. Her head dropped forward to where she could see only the two heaving mounds on her chest through deadened eyes; her arms hung limply to her side. The creature walked around her for a moment, poking and prodding her full-bodied and cushy form.

Then the creature tapped a button on its wrist device, shimmered momentarily like a hologram, and stood directly in front of the immobile woman; then it simply backed up into her body. The officer’s head perked up, and her eyes gave off a green glow. A long lizard tongue popped from her mouth, slithered about in the air for a moment, then went back in. The creature used its new body to take deep breaths of the morning air, its host’s bosom and belly seeming to expand and contract mightily with each breath. Rather awkwardly, the officer turned and walked in an almost robotic fashion toward the door of the warehouse…nearer the outside world.


Nick Trask ambled through the dark steel behemoth. He was self-assured, being an educated man with an exemplary record, but the brass in the administration wanted to keep him where he was; promoting him would mean losing his talent, and the guys the next rung up on the ladder would have to compete with him; they didn’t want that. Add to this the fact that Nick’s wife Jennifer was very pregnant; he needed to make his kid proud of him, and that’s tough to do just being a beat cop.

Better suited for knowledge work behind a desk or strategizing the next big bust, Trask’s out-of-shape body lumbered through the warehouse, his pudgy belly straining against a thin dress shirt. Suddenly, he heard a faint noise….a sort of slithering sound. “Brenda,” he called out, “what the hell is that? A broken steam pipe or something?” No answer. Trask walked on bemoaning the soiled state of his new dress shoes.

Suddenly, a creature lunged at him! This was a slimy, reptilian thing with human-like features and some cyber enhancements, as shown by some electronic equipment seemingly melded into the creature’s body. The thing lunged at Trask, who began to yell out, “What the f…” only to have the thing open wide and spit a sort of vapor into his opened mouth and nostrils. Trask immediately went unconscious, but his body stayed up. His head dropped limply down, and his arms hung weak at his sides. The creature examined him for a minute, pressed a button implanted into its wrist, and simply walked into Trask’s waiting, limp body. Immediately, his head shot up, and a green glow came from his eyes. A reptilian tongue escaped his lips for a moment, then slithered back into his mouth. Silently, the creature walked its new vessel toward the front door of the warehouse…toward civilization.


The two officers’ bodies made their way into the now-bright morning outside the warehouse. They approached each other, each looking at the other. The creature in Trask spoke first, “You found a vessel, 2112?” he asked, referring to his companion by a designated number. His voice was not Trask’s, but rather a gravelly, guttural noise far lower than a normal human voice. “Indeed I have, 5150,” replied the creature in Brenda in the same strange vocal pattern. “I think…just a moment,” Brenda said as the alien adjusted something about her body, “I think these forms will be quite useful,” the alien declared, now in the natural, womanly voice that was his host’s. “This body is female,” Brenda explained, examining her breasts and groin region, “and our records indicate it is the sort many desire for mating. She is of breeding age, and we can use her belly to incubate our young so our numbers will grow,” Brenda said, running her hands across her stomach.
“My body is….none of those,” Trask declared. “But we are both enforcers of sorts on this planet, and that will be useful. We shall find the human who dares use our proprietary technology, rip him from whatever body he hides in, and GRIND HIS BONES INTO DUST!!!” Trask declared emphatically.

“We should use these bodies when possible,” Brenda said, “but if you must inhabit a new husk, you need only press your hand against the body you wish to have and will the transfer to happen.” “Right,” Trask responded.

info.brief_description: A career criminal is imbued with incredible powers, which he'll use to his advantage.
info.description:
The main protagonist, 33-year old Carl Jason Edwards, is a career criminal, responsible for dozens of burglaries and and assaults. He has often thought about committing bigger crimes but is not prepared to spend a long stretch of time in prison. Years of his life already spent in juvenile centers and prison have taken their toll on his mental well being, driving him to smoke and drink a lot. Carl's physical appearance is 5' 11", short, scruffy, black hair, unshaven face and untidy street clothes (i.e jeans, sneakers etc.).

Because of his negative personality, Carl no longer has friends, and the only girlfriend he ever had, Melissa, had dumped him three years ago when he refused to give up his life of crime.

But one day, while heading back to his apartment after a heavy drinking session, Carl witnesses something falling from the sky, landing on deserted ground behind an old warehouse with a thud. After approaching the strange object, he discovers it is some kind of alien artifact that seems to be glowing, but not just from heat due to entry into the Earth's atmosphere.

When he touches it in his drunken state...he gets more than he bargained for.

The powers Carl receives are...

1. The ability to turn/morph other people into physical copies of himself (their clothes can either change also, or they can stay the same, your choice). The people he changes have to be nearby, in his line of sight so to speak. (Any mental changes, if any, are up to the individual author).

2. The power to possess other people's bodies by sending clones of himself into them. He can do this a limitless number of times, though try to keep the number sensible. Again, distance is a factor, the other people have to be somewhere in the vicinity.

3. He can leave his own body entirely and just possess someone else's body, but he would have to make sure that his own body is somewhere safe, as it will be 'pilotless' so to speak if he does this. Once more, and perhaps inevitably, distance is a factor, though he can travel several miles in his non-corporeal form. Please keep celebrities out of it, that's been done to death, lol.

4. Shapeshifting, Carl will have the ability to morph his body into any other human form, regardless of gender.

Note: A few people will be immune to his powers, but not many.

Rules:
Not many restrictions on this one, if any, but everything has rules.
Swearing/cursing is permitted.
No killing the main character, at least not straight away, lol.
Please try to keep spelling and grammar to a high quality (I do realize typos are sometimes unavoidable, I can correct these)
Other than that, no limitations.

100 Gift Points for a lesser one.
